chunks.translated_text:
The single qi soars high in ascent.
Pushing and shifting, movement and stillness divide ascent and descent,
Drawing in floating and sinking—creation returns to the root.
Guiding the nurture of the Valley Spirit that never dies,
Manifesting the blockage of Dui, sealing its gate.
Seven stars arrayed, encircling Kunlun,
Directing acceptance and rejection, governing existence.
Supporting the daily advance of the effortless Dao,
Revealing divine radiance—golden light surges high.
Skillfully brewing blossoms into refinement,
Dew reveals the mysterious body, verifying the yang soul.

---

Qian and Kun’s simplicity determines long life.
Pushing transformations, emptiness and fullness alternate.
Silently aligning with the four seasons’ divine workings,
Releasing harmonious balance—all things take form.
Nurturing deep roots, securing the stem,
Facing the golden well, spilling jade blossoms.
Fragrant guise adorns the brightening rosy clouds,
Amidst the clamor of ten thousand sounds, all is clear.
Creation’s obscurity holds being within non-being,
Revealing the August Void—yang’s body takes flight.
Freely roaming the Dharma realms,
Expanding spiritual transformation, merging into namelessness.

---

Qian and Kun’s cauldron seethes, refining the divine elixir.
Gathering tiger’s lungs and dragon’s liver,
Harmonizing toad and phoenix, congealing auspicious signs,
Transforming fullness into emptiness—sweet dew cascades.
Gathering and refining, brewing into golden liquid,
Spraying true flavor, fragrant as pepper and orchid.
Towering, one drinks deeply, drunk and riding the simurgh,
Melodies of dharma tunes strummed and sung.
Dancing sleeves swirl, countenance composed,
Defiant of the clear wind, the boundless moonlit sky.
A life of pure coolness and vitality,
Seizing eternal spring, attaining true reverence.

---

Qian and Kun’s distribution divides spring and autumn.
Advancing nine and six, adding and withdrawing.
Yang ascends, yin returns—primordial qi revives,
Assisting the numinous terrace, balancing firmness and softness.
Advancing eight, returning six, gathering in convergence,
Determining floating and sinking, revealing true cultivation.
Jade nectar of eight flavors flows in a single stream,
Gathering a hundred treasures in accord.
Nourishing the sage-king, the people prosper in peace,
Joyously carefree, galloping through the spirit continents.
Heaven and earth cannot mold or cast,
The effortless body roams freely at will.

---

Qian and Kun’s line-bodies intertwine,
Governing creation’s mechanism and power.
Firmness and softness transform, dividing movement and stillness,
Revolving and generating, aligning with the celestial cycle.
Sun and moon, yin and yang pair,
Gathering in the earth chamber, securing unity.
Two essences nurtured, entering the jade field,
Stacked like jade and snow, round and full.
Securing the path of long life along Caoxi’s way,
Wandering the five lakes and four seas.
Comprehending the honored Chan patriarch’s intent,
Embracing true joy, returning to ease.

---

Qian and Kun’s lines revolve, qi swirls in the mysterious yellow.
Drawing in the advance and retreat of yin and yang,
Creation’s numbers align with the fire’s timing,
Moving the clear wind, turning the celestial pivot in succession.
Simplicity shifts between floating and sinking,
Exhaling and inhaling, brewing jade nectar.
Immortal youths raise goblets, playing palace tunes,
Leading song and dance in graceful sway.
Half-drunk in the fading moonlight,
Host and guest laugh and jest in the central hall.
Subduing demonic hordes to flee,
Mastering the patriarch’s intent, turning toward cool clarity.

The nature’s radiance blazes.
Above, it scorns the three heavens, the body beyond,
Observing form and manifesting non-duality.
Distinctly, in each and every thing,
The full revelation of the Western Patriarch’s intent.

*Qiangtouhua*

*Guan*

chunks.original_text: 坤元复本，捧出纯乾位。 两正分形体离器。 含弘光大，冥冥无像，阳魂显瑞。 不空不有，唤觉西来意。 物我光尘总无累。 如今了了元初，遍撒诸方不二。 相无仪，神无碍，通千变，体一致。 朗朗真空露究竟，圆通貌清粹。 巍巍一混希夷，生灭梯磴远离。 减字木兰花　九还阳丹进道 长男尊女。 甲帐辛堂同宴处。 一返游魂。 闪烁垆开火力温。 风雷酷烈。 威赫云深明电掣。 烟雨蒙蒙。 飞下金乌宿桂宫。 右初一日，震偶巽。 一阳光启。 戊室盘旋离合体。 二返铅葩。 汞鼎温温进火车。 深连巨海。 踊出神鳖飞五彩。 洞琐烟霞。 密罩金童弄月华。 右初二日，坎偶离。 山通泽气。 乱卷云腾风浪沸。 三返垆煎。 炽焰炎炎映洞天。 奇莲焕吐。 五叶香浮霞万缕。 信手拈来。 捧弄轻便上月台。 右初三日，艮偶兑。 乾坤呈瑞。 六合三才八卦备。 四返归真。 一粒神丹气像新。 见前心定。 酩酊沉沉浑未醒。 子母团圆。 云步长春法界天。 右初四日，乾偶坤，通得六合。 巽荣春谷。 辛水溶溶滋震木。 五返云雷。 玉桂蟾宫应候开。 月娥清写。 风震庚金调木马。 功显强兵。 火衮深渊四海平。 右初五日，巽配震。 己从戊室。
chunks.translated_text:
*The Earth’s Primordial Return*

The Earth’s primordial origin restored, pure Qian’s position is held aloft.
The two rectitudes divide, forms and vessels part.
Vast and magnanimous, luminous and great,
In profound obscurity, without image,
The yang-soul manifests its auspiciousness.
Neither empty nor existent, it awakens the intent of the Western Advent.
The radiance of self and things, all without encumbrance.
Now, utterly lucid, returning to the primordial origin,
It scatters everywhere the non-dual.
Forms without appearance, spirit without hindrance,
Through a thousand transformations, the body remains one.
Luminous and clear, true emptiness reveals its ultimate,
The all-pervading countenance pure and unadulterated.
Towering, merged in the wondrous and formless,
The ladder of arising and ceasing far transcended.

*Magnolia Flower with Reduced Characters*
*Nine Yang-Returning Elixirs Ascending the Dao*

**Eldest Son Honors the Venerable Woman**
In the Jia tent and Xin hall, they feast as one.
The wandering soul returns once more,
Flickering, the furnace opens, fire’s warmth kindled.

Fierce as wind and thunder,
Majestic, clouds deepen, lightning flashes bright.
Misty as rain and haze,
The golden crow descends to lodge in the osmanthus palace.

*Right: First Day, Zhen paired with Xun*
A single yang’s radiance awakens.
In the Wu chamber, spiraling, the body unites and parts.

**Second Return: Lead’s Blossom**
The mercury crucible, gently warmed, advances the fire-cart.
Deeply linked to the vast sea,
A divine turtle leaps forth, soaring in five hues.
Cavern’s mist and rosy clouds,
Densely veiling the golden youth playing with moonlight.

*Right: Second Day, Kan paired with Li*
Mountains commune with marsh qi,
Chaotic clouds surge, wind and waves seethe.

**Third Return: Furnace’s Refinement**
Blazing flames illuminate the cavern-heaven.
Wondrous lotus unfurls,
Five-petaled fragrance floats in myriad rosy strands.
Casually plucked,
Lightly cradled, ascending the moonlit terrace.

*Right: Third Day, Gen paired with Dui*
Qian and Kun manifest auspiciousness,
The Six Harmonies, Three Powers, and Eight Trigrams complete.

**Fourth Return: Return to the Real**
A single grain of divine elixir, qi and image renewed.
Seeing the prior mind settled,
Intoxicated, deeply sunk, yet wholly unawakened.
Mother and child reunited,
Cloud-stepping into the ever-spring dharma-realm.

*Right: Fourth Day, Qian paired with Kun, achieving the Six Harmonies*
Xun flourishes the spring valley,
Xin’s waters, flowing and full, nourish Zhen’s wood.

**Fifth Return: Clouds and Thunder**
The jade osmanthus of the lunar palace blooms in season.
The moon goddess clearly transcribes,
Wind shakes Geng’s metal, tuning the wooden horse.
Merit displays its might,
Fire’s robe descends into the abyss, the four seas stilled.

*Right: Fifth Day, Xun paired with Zhen*
Ji follows the Wu chamber.

The medicinal flavors simmered and refined into jade essence.
Sixth Return: golden light.
Fierce flames glow brightly, filling the chamber.

The body suffused with pure fragrance.

Marsh and mountain share a vessel.

Seventh Return: the elixir is formed.
Distant radiance of streaming clouds shines upon Jade Clarity.
Qi settled, spirit stabilized,
Washing away worldly vexations, the moon of the heart gleams.
Alone, the zenith of meditation is revealed,
Ten thousand ripples stilled, equally round.

Kun and Qian in harmonious affection.
Twelve revolutions of the celestial cycle, the two sixes clarified.
The Eight Trigrams circulate endlessly,
Driving and guiding yin and yang through the workings of creation.
The time is ripe for union and peace.
At dawn’s misty confluence, spirit and qi meet,

Moved through the three threes and nine nines of heaven.

chunks.original_text: 鼎冷丹凝常乐冷。 烜赫金光。 透体明连满室香。 右九日九阳而还元。 会真集卷之二 #1戊丁：原误作『戊癸』。 会真集卷之三 超然子王吉昌撰 月中仙　九转功成 道泄冲和，运开基杳冥，生发元首。 推排七返，配二三成六，再三成九。 九还真造化，分八卦、妻男自偶。 默默真情契，凝然气神，如一镇相守。 盈虚动静归元，证不空不有。 头面仍旧。 无为性普，应地天神化，视之能久。 任从劫运变，太空体、绵绵不朽。 次了无生灭，恢弘妙用真乐受。 风入松　炼神合道 太阴二八产纯乾。 抱六合真筌。 二气经营元数足，始离形、祖意空传。 变态超尘契圣，显物外，性空圆。 冥冥反朴表精研。 越枯木岩前。 拍手归来明月下，拉清风、戏舞瑶天。 笑傲华胥真境，喜坦荡，梦游仙。 又 炼神入道混融成。 表真净真清。 造化阳魂离体变，恣纵横、触处蓬瀛。 野鹤孤云无碍，观自在，任飞行。 死生宠辱不须惊。 得久视长生。 欣见主人真头面，露堂堂、妙体峥嵘。 了了圆空一着，形无像，道为名。 绿头鸭　大圆觉海 混融成。 大圆觉海峥嵘。 性珠显、恢弘祖意，慧风通、虚谷传声。 有中无、无中有有，应变处、廓尔纵横。 坦荡融通，杳冥豁爽，澄澄一混体无荣。 证动静、俱忘何在，触处露圆明。 如如貌、莫形莫状，真浄真清。 灵通像、不增不减，罄劫来一段光荣。 无限域、含容万有，遍四海、三际充盈。 荏苒冲虚，无离无坏，浩然一点括长生。 证本有、巍巍极致，奇特体妍精。 这模样、人能悟入，与道同名。 又 貌幽玄。 混成法像无边。 悟真常、灵明妙用，越骊珠、独耀深渊。 衒真圣、穿山透壁，展威风、入地升天。 变化多方，神通挥霍，一输炳耀显孤圆。 浄洒洒、难握难把，朗朗湛如然。 无为相、高低莫测，远近难诠。 非空色、亦无二体，显本来、清净因缘。 大千界、浑无挂碍，证方寸、拍塞坤乾。 究竟圆通，不离不即，堂堂恢廓体翛然。 括慧灼、天真至理，悟入奋威权。 妙中妙、腾今跨古，无像功全。 瑞鹤仙 五行生数至成数 五行真气集。 通玄牝、谷神应时出入。 绵绵定呼吸。 显平调荣卫，蠕分和辑。 脉方动十。 得火候、熏蒸自给。 荡百骸、九窍关开，上下泝流相袭。 功及三天两地，九六阴通，七八阳立。 降升气揖。 推造化，宝瓶缉。 配刚柔合体，抽添循数，养就神丹一粒。 变阳魂、法界恢弘，跨云步急。 瑞鹤仙 成数造化金丹 金丹真造化。 在进火、功夫抽添相亚。 绵绵息全藉。 配天关地轴，器垆形借。 铅消汞泻，引彩凤、金乌自下。 入黄庭、展转相交，降升两情迎迓。 多暇月娥捧酒，间簇笙簧，喜连夙夜。 仙童力霸。 乘空舞，彩云跨。 向三天深处，放怀如意，五色光辉紧射。 料玉壶、九转金成，殆难估价。 又 炼丹成数究。
chunks.translated_text:
The crucible cools, the elixir congeals—ever in joyful stillness.
Radiant golden light blazes,
Pervading the body, luminous and unbroken, filling the chamber with fragrance.

*Right: Ninth Day, the nine yangs return to the origin.*

**Moon Immortal**
Ninefold refinement perfected,
The Dao spills forth harmonious qi,
Driving the workings of the primal dark, giving rise to the origin’s head.
Advancing and retreating through seven returns,
Pairing two and three to make six, then thrice three to make nine.
The nine returns complete the true workings of creation,
Dividing the Eight Trigrams, where wife and husband naturally pair.
In silent accord, true nature contracts,
Qi and spirit congeal as one, steadfastly guarding.
Fullness and emptiness, movement and stillness return to the origin,
Attesting to neither void nor existence.
The face remains as before.
In effortless virtue, universally pervading,
Responding to earth and heaven’s divine transformations, enduring in sight.
Let the kalpas shift as they may—
The body of the great void, unbroken and eternal.
Next, transcending birth and extinction,
Expansive and wondrous, true joy is received.

**Wind in the Pines: Refining Spirit to Merge with the Dao**
The Great Yin’s two eights yield pure Qian,
Embracing the Six Harmonies’ true key.
The two qi’s cultivation fulfills the primal number,
First parting from form, the ancestral intent transmitted in emptiness.
Transforming beyond the dust to contract with the sacred,
Manifesting beyond phenomena, nature’s emptiness perfected.
In profound obscurity, returning to simplicity’s refined essence,
Surpassing the withered tree before the cliff.
Clapping hands, returning beneath the bright moon,
Drawing the clear wind to play and dance in the jade heavens.
Laughing and roaming the true realm of Huaxu,
Delighted and untrammeled, dreaming of wandering as an immortal.

**Also: Refining Spirit to Enter the Dao, Merging into Oneness**
Manifesting true purity, true clarity.
The workings of creation—yang’s soul departs the body, transforming,
Freely and boundlessly, touching everywhere as Penglai’s isles.
Wild cranes and solitary clouds unobstructed,
Beholding self-mastery, soaring at will.
Birth and death, honor and disgrace need not alarm.
Attaining enduring vision and longevity,
Joyfully beholding the master’s true visage,
Revealing in full splendor the wondrous body’s majesty.
Perfectly realizing the one stroke of round emptiness,
Form without image, the Dao as its name.

**Green-Headed Duck: The Great Ocean of Perfect Awakening**
Merging into oneness,
The great ocean of perfect awakening stands majestic.
The pearl of nature shines forth, expansively manifesting the ancestral intent,
Wisdom’s wind passes through the empty valley, transmitting sound.
Within being, non-being; within non-being, being—
In response to change, vast and unconfined.
Untrammeled and fused, profound and bright,
Limpid and boundless, a single undifferentiated body without glory.
Witnessing movement and stillness, both forgotten—where do they reside?
Everywhere, the radiance of perfect clarity is revealed.
Suchness in form, neither shaped nor shapeless,
Truly pure, truly clear.
Spirit’s resonance, neither increasing nor diminishing,
For kalpas untold, a single radiance endures.
Limitless realms, containing the ten thousand beings,
Pervading the four seas, filling the three times.
Gentle and void, neither departing nor decaying,
Vast and luminous, a single point embracing longevity.
Attesting to the original possession of the towering ultimate,
The marvelous body exquisitely refined.
In this manner, if one can awaken and enter,
They share the Dao’s name.

**Also: The Profound and Mysterious Form**
The merged dharma-image without bounds.
Awakening to the true and constant,
The numinous and wondrous workings surpass the black pearl’s solitary radiance in the deep abyss.
Displaying true sageliness, piercing mountains and walls,
Unfurling majesty, entering earth and ascending heaven.
Transformations in myriad forms,
Divine powers swiftly deployed,
A single luminous orb brilliantly displayed.
Pure and unadorned, difficult to grasp or seize,
Lucid and resplendent, thus it naturally is.
The formless form, beyond high or low, beyond near or far,
Neither void nor form, nor a second body,
Revealing the original, pure causal ground.
The great thousand worlds, utterly without hindrance,
Attesting within the square inch, filling heaven and earth.
Ultimately fused and unobstructed,
Neither apart nor identical,
The body vast and free, towering and unbounded.
Encompassing wisdom’s brilliance, the celestial truth’s essence,
Awakening to exert mighty power.
Within the wondrous, transcending past and present,
The formless work perfected.

**Auspicious Crane Immortal: The Generative and Completion Numbers of the Five Phases**
The five phases’ true qi gathers,
Communing with the mysterious feminine,
The valley spirit responding in timely egress and ingress.
In continuous, settled breathing,
Revealing the balanced harmony of construction and defense,
Subtly dividing and harmonizing.
When the pulse first stirs tenfold,
With the fire’s timing, steaming and nourishing of itself.
Sweeping through the hundred bones, the nine orifices’ gates open,
Above and below, flowing and ascending in mutual succession.
The work extends through the three heavens and two earths,
The nine sixes of yin communicate, the seven eights of yang stand firm.
Descending and ascending qi bow,
Advancing creation, the precious vessel is woven.
Matching hardness and softness in unity,
Drawing and adding in accord with number,
Nurturing the single grain of spirit-elixir.
The yang soul transforms, the dharma-realm expands,
Striding swiftly upon the clouds.

**Auspicious Crane Immortal: The Completion Numbers’ Creation of the Golden Elixir**
The golden elixir’s true creation,
In advancing the fire, the work of drawing and adding refines.
Continuous breath wholly relies upon it,
Matching heaven’s gate and earth’s axis,
Borrowing the crucible’s form.
Lead dissolves, mercury pours,
Drawing the colorful phoenix and golden crow to descend.
Entering the Yellow Court, revolving in mutual exchange,
Descending and ascending, the two natures welcome and receive.
The moon goddess, with ample leisure, offers wine,
Amidst clustered reed pipes and flutes,
Joyfully connecting day and night.
The immortal youths exert their strength,
Riding the void, dancing upon colored clouds.
Toward the depths of the three heavens,
Releasing the heart’s intent,
The five-colored radiance shines intensely.
Surely the jade flask’s ninefold gold is perfected,
Its value beyond estimation.

**Also: Refining the Elixir to Completion’s Number.**

chunks.original_text: 三八为刀息缓留，圭凭戊己吸呼修。 飞伏十干证添抽。 造化结成仙药体，依时饵讫御神游。 日飞天外得优游。 又 饮息时时药味加，五神运起海金沙。 天河仙子渡灵槎。 水满金城凝露冷，人牛不见月空华。 清风捧拥笑归家。 万年春 玉琐金关互换封闭 玉琐金关，阴阳击柝牢封闭。 相凝制。 变通无系。 满腹清风细。 九气天中，云买步无纤翳。 真根蒂。 道情潜契。 湛湛通三际。 又 一气冲和，心猿紧琐难奔走。 调柔受。 密封关口。 太一氤氲守。 二者相融，默默昏昏久。 成奇偶。 炼须九九。 丕享虚空寿。 又 浩气流行，绵绵拥簇真禅定。 颐神兴。 杳冥难醒。 凝结玄黄孕。 造化圆空，剔透灵台莹。 能常应。 木童形胜。 稳步云霞径。 江神子慢　真坐 修真万缘擎。 心地下、功夫要刚烈。 育愚拙。 放四大、自在安闲不惙。 志如铁。 强斩马猿双足折。 罢颠劣、都收归寂灭。 八关六腑三宫，总和畅，万神悦。 龟息玄通无间，得澄湛子母，团圆交结。 两情泄。 显阳体、炼就飞行时节。 意冰洁。 造化真空归物外，无为道、圆成还若缺。 放开性月辉辉，贯乾坤彻。 江神子慢　伪坐 谷神死不作。 蛰窟彼、心迷有功错。 妄穿凿。 搜玄妙、水谷云根为托。 谩消索。 扭捏一身常把捉。 相专着、地关无锁钥。 天门不折弥封，岂留气，有无若。 难为三宫升降，执一性返失，西来糟粕。 道情薄。 乖魂魄、动静龙虎盘礴。 昧崇钥。 怎炼玉垆金水结，无丹体、何能云步乐。 傥还剔透玄机，会蓬莱约。 无俗念　气邪 一呼一吸，昧谷神、玄牝绵绵踵至。 聚散忙忙乖造化，根蒂悬悬远离。 上下无归，往来失御，不向三宫施。 内迷归胜，意因执定一位。 外灌四体皮肤，浮行散乱，蠢蠢难安置。 壮观浑身多震动，变易千般何啻。 意不灰寒，形不木槁，性命云泥异。 禅功郁结，怎成阳体纯粹。 江梅引　气邪归正 浩然气动混元宫。 契修崇，运清风。 透彻三关，上下自然充。 胜外浮游收入内，尽一指，都归玉路中。 神迎天谷傲晴空。 养冲融，得疏通。 体了无萦，澄湛证参同。 物我两忘真豁畅，无为理，至圆成，显圣功。 江梅引　神邪 四肢气散失根芽。 作神邪，发空华。 异物千般，目下乱如麻。 一切圣贤随意现，总变化，都因一念差。 不知心病尚强夸。 景无涯，事为嘉。 特昧玄通，道眼被尘遮。 不作真禅成魔境，阴阳隔，看如何，炼玉砂。 江梅引　神邪归正 灵襟澡雪蔑尘污。 幻形刳，外容愚。 恬淡场中，驰骤道情娱。 一气制神神酩酊，乘醉舞，金童玉女扶。 玄机真造志勤劬。 蜕凡躯，入虚无。 恢廓圆明，性月一轮孤。 冷浸禅天风雾静，冰肌彩，傲澄澄，晃玉壶。 又 景忘情灭万缘疏。 览涤除，道情舒。 把握权舆，神息动徐徐。 将养灵台山岳静，常默默，调神定有余。 森罗真境傲华胥。 显元初，妙如如。 无像堂堂，模样契冲虚。 飞舞游嬉无挂碍，狂歌咏，恣欣欣，类接舆。 又 万斜不作一灵孤。 妙容模，契虚无。 觉海纵横，独耀越骊珠。 云静水寒无点翳，清净体，穿山透壁殊。 无人野上傲双凫。 奋天衢，玩仙都。 一点圆明，变化不能拘。 腹实冲和怀美玉，密藏匮，更不求，善价沽。 月中仙　宾主互换 索妙修真，分元神作宾，一气为主。 玄机不昧，凭坎离精粹，权衡三五。
chunks.translated_text:
The triple-eight forms the knife’s breath, lingering slow,
The *gui* relies on *wu-ji*’s inhalation and exhalation to refine.
Flying and concealing, the ten stems attest to added growth.
When creation congeals the immortal elixir’s body,
Consume it in due time to ascend in spirit-flight—
Beyond the sun’s flight, one attains carefree wandering.

*Again*
With each breath, the medicinal aroma deepens,
The five spirits stir, stirring golden sand from the sea.
The immortal of the Celestial River ferries the sacred raft.
Water fills the golden city, congealing cold dew,
Man and ox vanish, the moon shines empty splendor—
A pure wind bears one homeward in laughter.

*Ten Thousand Springtimes*
Jade lock and golden pass exchange seals and closures—

Jade lock and golden pass,
Yin and yang strike the watchman’s clapper, firmly sealed.
Mutually congealing, they restrain.
Transforming without attachment,
The belly brims with fine, cool wind.
In the nine qi of heaven,
Clouds tread without the slightest veil.
The root and stem of Dao,
Silently harmonizing,
Pervade the three realms in clarity.

*Again*
A single qi of harmonious surge,
The heart-ape tightly locked, unable to flee.
Tamed and softened, it receives—
The pass is sealed in secrecy,
Guarded by the Great One’s misty embrace.
When the two merge,
Silent and dim, they endure long—
Forming the odd and even,
Refinement must reach nine nines.
Then one enjoys the boundless longevity of emptiness.

*Again*
Vast qi flows and circulates,
Continuously cradling true *chan* stillness.
Nurturing the spirit, it rises—
Profound and obscure, hard to awaken,
Congealing the mysterious and yellow to gestate.
Creation’s round emptiness,
Polishes the spirit-terrace to translucence.
Ever responsive,
The wood-child’s form excels,
Stepping steadily along the cloud-radiance path.

*Slow Tune of the River Spirit: True Sitting*
Cultivating truth amidst ten thousand entanglements,
The mind’s ground demands fierce effort.
Nurturing the foolish and clumsy,
Releasing the four great elements,
One rests at ease, untroubled.
Will like iron—
Vigorously severing the horse and ape, breaking both legs,
Ceasing all waywardness, gathering all into quiescence.
The eight passes, six viscera, and three palaces,
All harmonized and smooth,
The ten thousand spirits rejoice.
Tortoise-breath, mysterious and unbroken,
Attains limpid stillness—mother and child,
Round and conjoined.
The two natures merge—
Revealing the yang body,
Refined to the moment of flight.
The mind, ice-pure,
Creation’s true emptiness returns beyond things,
The effortless Dao, perfectly complete, yet seeming incomplete.
Releasing the nature-moon’s radiance,
It pierces through heaven and earth.

*Slow Tune of the River Spirit: False Sitting*
The valley spirit dies, unaroused,
Burrowed in delusion, the heart errs in its merit.
Futilely chiseling,
Seeking the mysterious and wondrous,
Relying on the water and grain’s cloud-root.
Wasted effort—
Twisting and contorting the body, constantly grasping,
Focusing intently, the earthly pass lacks lock and key.
The heavenly gate remains unbroken, tightly sealed,
How could qi linger between being and non-being?
The three palaces’ ascent and descent are hindered,
Clinging to one nature, losing the returned,
The dregs of the Western advent.
Dao’s essence thins—
The soul and spirit stray,
In motion and stillness, dragon and tiger coil.
Ignorant of the sacred key,
How can one refine the jade crucible’s golden water?
Without the elixir’s body,
How could one tread the clouds in joy?
If by chance the mysterious mechanism becomes clear,
One may meet the Penglai covenant.

*No Mundane Thoughts: Qi Deviance*
One breath, one sigh,
Ignoring the valley spirit, the mysterious female’s continuity falters.
Hurried gathering and scattering defy creation,
Root and stem hang precariously, far removed.
No return above or below,
Coming and going lose control,
Not directed toward the three palaces.
Internally lost, seeking the superior,
The mind clings to one fixed point.
Externally flooding the four limbs and skin,
Floating and scattered, restless,
Clumsily unsettled.
Beholding the body’s many tremors,
Transforming a thousandfold—how could it be otherwise?
The mind not reduced to cold ashes,
The form not withered like deadwood,
Life and nature diverge like cloud and mud.
Chan’s power stagnates—
How could one achieve the pure yang body?

*Plum Blossoms by the River: Qi Deviance Returned to Right*
A vast qi stirs in the Primordial Palace,
Aligning with refined cultivation, moving the pure wind.
Piercing the three passes,
Naturally filling above and below.
The victorious external wanderings are drawn inward,
All in one finger’s span,
Gathered into the jade path’s midst.
The spirit welcomes the celestial valley, proud in the clear sky,
Nurturing harmony and fusion, attaining free flow.
The body, unentangled, becomes limpid—
Profound stillness verifies the *Can Tong Qi*.
Self and other both forgotten, truly expansive,
The principle of non-action,
Perfectly complete,
Reveals sacred merit.

*Plum Blossoms by the River: Spirit Deviance*
The four limbs’ qi scatters, losing root and sprout—
Becoming spirit deviance, emitting empty flowers.
A thousand strange phenomena,
Before the eyes, chaotic as hemp.
All sages and worthies appear at will,
Transforming endlessly,
All due to a single thought’s deviation.
Unaware of the heart’s illness, still boasting,
Scenes boundless, affairs deemed fine.
Specially obscuring the mysterious and unobstructed,
The Dao-eye veiled by dust.
Not practicing true *chan*, one falls into demonic realms—
Yin and yang sundered,
See how one refines the cinnabar sand.

*Plum Blossoms by the River: Spirit Deviance Returned to Right*
The numinous breast, washed clean of dust and filth,
The illusory form hollowed, the outer guise foolish.
In the tranquil and indifferent realm,
One gallops, delighting in Dao’s essence.
A single qi restrains the spirit, the spirit intoxicated,
Riding drunkenness in dance,
Golden lads and jade maidens lend support.
The mysterious mechanism’s true creation demands diligent effort—
Shedding the mortal frame,
Entering emptiness.
Expansive and luminous,
The nature-moon, solitary and round.
Coldly immersed in *chan*’s heaven, wind and mist still,
The ice-flesh’s radiance,
Proud and limpid,
Shines like a jade flask.

*Again*
Scenery forgotten, passions extinguished, ten thousand entanglements sparse,
Gazing and cleansing, Dao’s essence unfurls.
Grasping the origin,
Spirit and breath move slowly.
Nurturing the spirit-terrace, still as a mountain,
Ever silent,
Regulating the spirit, with surplus to spare.
The forest of true realms, proud in *Huaxu*,
Revealing the primordial beginning,
Wondrously thus.
Formless, majestic,
The appearance aligns with emptiness.
Dancing and frolicking, unobstructed,
Singing wildly,
Rejoicing unrestrained,
Like *Jieyu*.

*Again*
Ten thousand slants do not mar the solitary spirit’s wonder—
The wondrous appearance aligns with emptiness.
The sea of awakening, vast and boundless,
Shines uniquely, surpassing the black pearl.
Clouds still, water cold, without the slightest veil,
The pure body,
Pierces mountains and walls with ease.
In the wild, no one—proud as a pair of wild ducks,
Striding the heavenly thoroughfare,
Playing in the immortal capital.
A single point of round clarity,
Unrestrained by transformation.
The belly, full of harmonious surge, cradles fine jade,
Secretly stored in the treasury,
No longer seeking,
To sell at a good price.

*Immortal in the Moon: Guest and Host Exchange*
Seeking the wondrous, cultivating truth,
Dividing the primordial spirit as guest,
A single qi as host.
The mysterious mechanism unobscured,
Relying on Kan and Li’s essence,
Balancing the three and five.

The fire-refined jujube is carried by the youthful attendant.

*Again*
Diligently drinking the knife’s measure to refine utmost yang,
The steaming medicinal aroma permeates heaven’s fragrance,
Instantly spraying sweet dew, the soul-returning nectar.
Drinking to radiant intoxication, ever drunk through long days,
Whirling and dancing in time with reed pipes and flutes,

chunks.original_text: 浩然成造化，销尸魄、纯阳结聚。 七返真阴降，功全摄迹，归本认元祖。 炼神合道冥冥，始真空体露。 实相难睹。 无穷变化，显性珠如意，恢弘光吐。 独超三界外，令清净、腾今跨古。 反换宾为主，首提究竟功德普。 又 志士穷元，派浮沉动静，体用分别。 神初象客，藉氤氲为主，应时提挈。 杖头挑日月，斡天地、推移气泄。 北斗南辰转，辉辉洞天，深处木童悦。 而今主掌专权，证阳极返还，阴降时节。 真功造化，显本来体段，清辉冰洁。 焕然无点污，罄三界、十方透彻。 一混希夷化，不空不有无生灭。 武陵春　欲界 欲界谷神初剖判，情逸混冲融。 太一云兴匝地风，岳顶雨蒙蒙。 造化阴阳升降应，八脉醴泉通。 琴韵琅琅聒耳聪，绝念酝奇功。 又 一气始方离混沌，八卦九宫期。 罗络壶中媾坎离，消息浩充肌。 斡转璇玑神寂定，龙虎甲庚颐。 性普三宫造化奇，默默入希夷。 又 嗜爱顿忘情不纵，去智道颐形。 心迹交时醉半醒，子母聚黄庭。 九气天中呜玉韵，昼夜不曾停。 断送仙童入杳冥，变态奋威灵。 又 心乐澄澄时静应，阴裹媾阳精。 飒飒和风海底生，六腑九宫盈。 一气混挑罡斗转，天谷至神迎。 虑念俱无净德成，咫尺傲鹏程。 永遇乐　色界 心虑灰凝，妙圆德备，威仪无缺。 杳杳禅安，冥冥色碍，壶裹风光泄。 云霞来往，虎龙昤啸，捧弄木童神悦。 廓胸臆、洪饮冲和，坦荡醉吟时节。 笙歌鼎沸，惊凰风舞，纵横自在行列。 满目祥光，盈空瑞霭，隐隐飘红雪。 拍怀冰莹，充襟月冷，壮贯道情明彻。 傲真境、真乐真惧，出尘妙绝。 又 机括独行，犹然形累，庄严神正。 诸漏牢封，万缘齐剪，豁达开心镜。 禅关打破，壶春深入，万象拱环七政。 天河转、月窟光飞，低衬碧霄相映。 纯阳束体，瑞云高卧，轻清拂面风劲。 欢乐无涯，变通难约，时复狂歌咏。 笙簧缭绕，雷霆鼓润，做弄木童余庆。 冥冥 证、一点圆空，至清至净。
chunks.translated_text:
The vast qi shapes creation,
Dissolving the corpse’s poise, pure Yang coalesces.
The sevenfold return of true Yin descends,
Work complete, traces gathered,
Returning to recognize the primal ancestor.
Refining spirit to merge with the Dao in profound obscurity,
Only then does the true emptiness reveal its form.
The real mark is hard to behold.
Boundless transformations,
Manifest the luminous pearl of nature at will,
Radiating expansive light.
Alone transcending beyond the three realms,
Commanding purity to soar across past and present.
Reversing guest to host,
First elevating the ultimate merit of universal virtue.

---

The resolute scholar delves into the origin,
Discerning the floating and sinking, movement and stillness,
Distinguishing essence and function.
Spirit, initially a guest in form,
Relies on the misty qi as host,
Timely uplifted.
At the staff’s tip, sun and moon are borne,
Turning heaven and earth, shifting the qi’s flow.
The Northern Dipper and Southern Stars revolve,
Their brilliance illuminating the grotto-heaven,
Deep within, the Wood Lad rejoices.
Now the host wields sole authority,
Witnessing Yang’s extremity returning,
Yin descending in its season.
True work molds creation,
Revealing the original body’s state,
Its clear radiance pure as ice.
Resplendent, without a speck of defilement,
Resounding through the three realms,
Permeating the ten directions.
In utter oneness, transformed into the formless,
Neither empty nor existent, beyond birth and extinction.

---

*Wu Ling Chun: The Desire Realm*

In the Desire Realm, the Valley Spirit first divides,
Passions dissolved in harmonious fusion.
Great Unity’s clouds rise, earth-enveloping winds,
Peak-topped rains, mist-laden.

Creation’s Yin and Yang ascend and descend in accord,
The eight vessels flow with sweet spring’s nectar.
Zither tones, resonant and clear, stir the ears’ wisdom,
Utter stillness brews wondrous work.

---

One qi first parts from primordial chaos,
Awaiting the eight trigrams and nine palaces.
Within the crucible, Kan and Li unite,
Their subtle movements swelling through the flesh.

Turning the celestial pivot, spirit settles in stillness,
Dragon and Tiger harmonize with metal and wood.
Nature pervades the three palaces, creation’s marvel,
Silently entering the formless.

---

Desires suddenly forgotten, passions unindulged,
Abandoning cunning, the Dao nurtures form.
When heart and trace converge, half-drunk, half-sober,
Mother and child gather in the Yellow Court.

Nine qi in heaven resound with jade-like tones,
Day and night unceasing.
The immortal lad is ushered into the boundless,
Transforming, displaying mighty spirit.

---

When the heart delights in limpid stillness,
Yin within embraces Yang’s essence.
A rustling, harmonious wind rises from the sea’s depths,
Filling the six viscera and nine palaces.

One qi stirs, the Big Dipper turns,
The Celestial Valley welcomes the supreme spirit.
All thoughts dissolved, pure virtue perfected,
A mere footstep scorns the roc’s path.

---

*Yong Yu Le: The Form Realm*

Heart’s concerns congeal to ash,
Wondrous perfection, virtue complete,
Dignity flawless.
Profoundly serene in meditation,
Obscurely veiled by form,
Within the crucible, windscape revealed.
Clouds and mist come and go,
Tiger and Dragon chant and roar,
Delighting the Wood Lad’s spirit.
Expanding the chest, deeply drinking harmonious qi,
Unfettered, drunk in the season of chanting.

---

Pipes and songs boil like cauldrons,
Startling phoenixes dance,
Freely traversing in ranks.
All eyes filled with auspicious light,
The sky brimming with propitious mist,
Faintly drifting red snow.
Clapping the breast, ice gleams,
Filling the lapel, the moon chills,
Vigorously coursing with the Dao’s luminous clarity.
Proud in the true realm,
True joy, true awe,
Transcendent wonder unmatched.

---

The mechanism moves alone,
Yet still bound by form,
Dignified, spirit upright.
All leaks sealed,
All entanglements severed,
The heart’s mirror opened, vast and clear.
The meditation barrier shattered,
Deeply entering the crucible’s spring,
Myriad forms encircle the seven luminaries.
The Milky Way turns,
Light from the Moon’s Grotto flies,
Low against the azure sky, reflecting.

---

Pure Yang binds the body,
Auspicious clouds, high repose,
A light, crisp wind brushes the face.
Joy unbounded,
Transformations beyond measure,
At times, wild songs and chants.
Pipes and reeds swirl,
Thunder’s drums resound,
The Wood Lad plays in surplus blessing.
In profound obscurity,
Witnessing a single point of perfect emptiness,
Utmost purity, utmost clarity.

chunks.original_text: 长思仙　无色界 命还空，性还空。 物我双忘阐慧风。 冥冥一混同。 运神功，契鸿蒙。 反素灵光天地中。 虚形处处通。 又 定心惺，识心停。 主客同宫湛湛宁。 人牛不见形。 性真灵，像真灵。 动静无为混杳冥。 圆空上下经。 黄鹤洞中仙　顽空 深染顽空病，未识修真命。 徒昧阴阳变化机，密翳真心镜。 念断为见性，正是沉空净。 不炼成丹妙体全，久久难归圣。 又 性命根基奥，道本阴阳造。 孤守灵光一点清，殆失观天道。 三盗宜深讨，四象当逆考。 夺得乾坤造化权，结就圆明宝。 一剪梅　断空 夺得周天火候煎。 丹垆昼夜，煮汞烹铅。 海源江岸气喷烟。 继日奔腾，通贯三田。 不悟冥冥入定禅。 神离气散，子母难圆。 阴阳失媾昧玄玄。 九载三年，不见壶天。 又 一气升腾宝鼎煎。 相交水火，玉路飞铅。 不能神定两团圆。 隔若云泥，难契重玄。 切要澄心剿万缘。 自然性命，混合归禅。 阳魂变化恣升迁。 百日千朝，云步壶天。 望海潮　真空 真空根蒂，全凭神息，分开五蕴精华。 和畅六神，氤氲三岛，天河浪泛灵槎。 乾鼎煮丹砂。 正云驾坤牛，风送羊车。 密运黄金井，成灿烂，结琼花。 滋彰极妙生涯。 放空圆显理，玄览无瑕。 纯粹一真，通天透地，恢弘无障无遮。 方寸括河沙。 恣兴陪风月，醉卧烟霞。 个裹真消息，偏分付，道人家。 又 形神俱妙，灵通无碍，卓然独立玄玄。 显理简情，空色无阂，揭为究竟因缘。 祖意密空传。 自心境俱冥，智解都蠲。 一段真清净，廓神变，出坤乾。 恢弘妙体空圆。 露如如无像，高傲禅天。 烜赫慧光，峥嵘实相，森罗法界无边。 契道奋威权。 已打破虚空，劫力难煎。 擘碎输回壳，拉真一，度流年。 老君吟　三千功 清神夺凤髓，止息收乌血。 六阳飞宇宙，五气通关节。 云雷风电击，向三天，降冰雪。 瑶山海峤喷红雾，赫赫如晴，昼性光明彻。 两情结。 禅天齐物变，意写成惧悦。 阳魂全造化，号真功，功妙绝。 三千数合无圆缺。 神超归物外，永离生灭。 又 灵风透骨髓，秀气盈肢节。 抽添离与坎，动静相交设。 符数周天造，聚阴阳，气神结。 黄庭锦帐浑孕瑞，变化阳魂，胜地天通彻。 细分别。 三千 真造化，消息玄黄泄。 性光无点污，莹如冰，摅澡雪。 顿超三界真欢悦。 歌吟游阆苑，道情清绝。 老君吟　八百行 灵源无点污，常应常清净。 阴阳已罢交，子母同宫庆。 冲虚葆真一，廓圆明，辉心镜。 头头照破归寂灭，妙用弘法，海变通无竟。 具真行。 慈悲形道本，惨怛心无争。 普施咸利物，执谦德，为权柄。 圆成八百无漏果，顿超云步稳，脱凡归圣。 放心闲　返老还童 地水火风。 装成四大，到头衰老成空。 死生蝉蜕，凭据妙用修崇。 合天地、推移真造，阴阳运、匹配雌雄。 神胎剖判，氤氲圣体，轻健还童。 养就如如，玄皇消息，匠至虚、法像灵通。 密藏浩气，廓变化，体无穷。 恣烜赫、元初模样，跨鸾鹤、笑傲天宫。 纵横自在，显超凡入圣，千古清风。 又 一气玄功。
chunks.translated_text:
**Long Thought of the Immortal**

In the formless realm, life returns to emptiness,
Nature returns to emptiness.
Object and self both forgotten, the wind of wisdom unfurls,
In profound obscurity, all merges as one.

Exerting spiritual work, uniting with primordial chaos,
The pristine radiance of spirit shines amid heaven and earth.
The formless body flows freely everywhere.

---

The mind settled, awareness stilled,
Host and guest dwell together in profound tranquility.
Neither ox nor man is seen in form.
The true nature is numinous, the image is numinous,
In movement and stillness, non-doing merges with the boundless dark.
Perfect emptiness pervades above and below.

---

**Immortal of the Yellow Crane Grotto – Stubborn Emptiness**

Deeply stained by the illness of stubborn emptiness,
Unknowing of the true mandate of cultivation.
In vain, one remains blind to the transformations of yin and yang,
The true heart’s mirror shrouded in dense obscurity.

Severing thoughts to perceive the nature—
This is but sinking into hollow purity.
Without refining the elixir to perfect the wondrous body,
One shall never, even after long ages, return to sagehood.

---

The root of life and nature is profound,
The Dao’s foundation lies in yin and yang’s creation.
To cling solely to the purity of a single point of spirit’s light
Is to nearly lose sight of heaven’s Way.

The Three Thieves must be deeply investigated,
The Four Images must be inversely examined.
Seizing the power of heaven and earth’s transformations,
One crystallizes the treasure of perfect clarity.

---

**A Sprig of Plum Blossoms – Severing Emptiness**

Seizing the fire’s timing of the celestial cycle,
The elixir furnace burns day and night,
Simmering mercury, refining lead.
From the sea’s depths and riverbanks, qi billows like smoke,
Day after day surging, penetrating the Three Fields.

Failing to awaken, one sinks into the trance of profound meditation—
Spirit scatters, qi disperses,
Mother and child cannot unite.
Yin and yang lose their union, the mystery obscured.
For nine years and three, the crucible’s heaven remains unseen.

---

A single qi ascends, the precious tripod seethes,
Water and fire intermingle,
Lead flies along the jade path.
Yet without spirit’s steadfastness, the two cannot merge as one,
Separated as if by clouds and mud,
The profound mystery remains unattainable.

It is essential to still the heart and sever the myriad entanglements,
Then nature and life naturally blend, returning to Chan.
The yang soul transforms, freely ascending,
In a hundred days and a thousand mornings,
Cloud-stepping into the crucible’s heaven.

---

**Gazing at the Tide – True Emptiness**

True emptiness is the root and foundation,
Wholly reliant on spirit and breath,
Differentiating the essence of the Five Aggregates.
Harmonizing the six spirits, suffusing the Three Isles,
The Milky Way’s waves surge with the numinous raft.
The Qian tripod simmers cinnabar,
As clouds bear the Kun ox,
And the wind conveys the ram-drawn chariot.
Secretly circulating the Yellow Gold Well,
Forming resplendence, crystallizing jade-like blossoms.

The most wondrous livelihood flourishes,
Manifesting the principle in perfect emptiness,
With a profound vision unmarred.
Pure and undivided, the One True,
Penetrating heaven and earth,
Vast and unhindered, without obstruction.
The square inch of the heart encompasses river sands.
Freely delighting in wind and moon,
Intoxicated, reclining amid mist and rosy clouds.
Within this, the true message is imparted—
Bestowed solely upon the family of Daoists.

---

Form and spirit both wondrous,
Spirit unobstructed, transcendent,
Solemnly independent in profound mystery.
Revealing principle, simplifying emotions,
Emptiness and form without barrier,
Unveiling the ultimate cause.
The ancestral intent is secretly transmitted in emptiness.
As the mind’s realm and all phenomena dissolve,
Wisdom’s understanding is entirely dispelled.
A single stretch of true purity,
Expanding the spirit’s transformation,
Emerging from Kun and Qian.

The wondrous body of vast emptiness is perfected,
Manifesting thusness without image,
Loftily proud in the heavens of Chan.
Resplendent wisdom’s light,
Majestic true reality,
The boundless Dharma realm of the myriad phenomena.
Uniting with the Dao, one wields mighty power,
Having shattered the void,
Even kalpas’ force cannot refine.
Shattering the shell of rebirth,
Embracing the True One,
Transcending the flow of years.

---

**Laozi’s Chant – Three Thousand Merits**

Purifying the spirit, seizing the phoenix’s marrow,
Cessation of breath gathers the crow’s blood.
Six yangs soar through the cosmos,
Five qi penetrate the joints.
Clouds, thunder, wind, and lightning strike,
Toward the Three Heavens,
Descending ice and snow.
Jade mountains and sea peaks spew crimson mist,
Resplendent as daylight,
The nature’s light shines through.

The two passions unite.
The heavens of Chan equalize the transformations of things,
The mind writes the script of awe and joy.
The yang soul fully embodies creation,
Called true merit—
Merit most wondrous.
The three thousand numbers unite without flaw.
Spirit transcends beyond the realm of things,
Forever departing birth and extinction.

---

A numinous wind permeates the marrow,
Vital qi fills the limbs and joints.
Drawing and adding from Li and Kan,
In movement and stillness, they are arranged in exchange.
The tally of the celestial cycle is complete,
Gathering yin and yang,
Qi and spirit conjoin.
The Yellow Court’s brocade canopy is fully pregnant with auspice,
Transforming the yang soul,
The sacred land’s heaven is thoroughly penetrated.

In fine distinction,
The three thousand true transformations,
The ebb and flow of the mysterious and the yellow are revealed.
The nature’s light is without a speck of defilement,
Luminous as ice,
Spreading pure snow.
Instantly transcending the Three Realms in true joy,
Singing and chanting, wandering the Gardens of Lang,
The Dao’s sentiment is supremely pure.

---

**Laozi’s Chant – Eight Hundred Practices**

The numinous source is without a speck of defilement,
Ever responsive, ever pure.
Yin and yang have ceased their union,
Mother and child rejoice in the same palace.
Embracing the True One in emptiness,
Expanding perfect clarity,
Illuminating the heart’s mirror.
Everywhere, enlightenment shatters, returning to extinction,
The wondrous function of the Dharma vast and boundless.

Possessing true practice,
Compassion shapes the Dao’s foundation,
Sorrow and empathy, the heart without contention.
Universally bestowing, benefiting all things,
Holding humility as virtue,
Wielding it as authority.
Perfecting the eight hundred, the fruit of no-leakage,
Instantly transcending the cloud steps steadily,
Shedding the mortal to return to sagehood.

---

**Freeing the Heart – Returning to Youth**

Earth, water, fire, wind,
Composing the Four Great,
In the end, aging decays into emptiness.
Life and death, like the cicada’s molt,
Rely on wondrous work in solemn cultivation.
Uniting with heaven and earth, shifting true creation,
Yin and yang’s movement, matching female and male.
The spirit’s embryo splits and judges,
The numinous body suffuses in mist,
Light and healthy, returning to youth.

Nurturing thusness to perfection,
The mysterious emperor’s message,
Crafted to emptiness, the Dharma image spiritually penetrates.
Secretly harboring vast qi,
Expanding transformations,
The body boundless.
Freely resplendent, in the original form,
Mounting the simurgh and crane, laughing proudly in the heavens.
Unrestrained and at ease,
Manifesting transcendence from the mortal to the sage,
A thousand ages of pure wind.

---

A single qi’s mysterious work.

---

Pure Yang binds the body,
Auspicious clouds, high repose,
A light, crisp wind brushes the face.
Joy unbounded,

Pipes and reeds swirl,

chunks.original_text: 三奇真造，本来玉貌修完。 混归宝藏，密蕴九转神丹。 傲阳体、堂堂实相，栖真境、坦荡天宽。 从渠日月，忙催四大，迤逦衰残。 物壮难留，假躯易失，独卓尔、一点冰寒。 恢恢圣变，奋飞舞，恣吟弹。 伴云外、清风明月，放宛转、隐显多般。 还童不老，任灾临劫运，无像神安。 无俗念　火候不正 周天火候，要升沉飞伏，无差无错。 气运前升穿绛阙，透上九天熏烙。 两目难开，终为火患，急急须臾拨。 迁延岁月，变成魔境沦落。 六神失御猖狂，三尸放荡，五贼俱成恶。 要镇炎炎归玉路，深入神宫恢廓。 三盗循环，相交水火，锻炼成丹药。 驱驰归正，得醇贤圣糟粕。 感庭秋　全真 阴阳悉备道风淳。 精粹保天真。 分擘刚柔动静，炼九还、丹体清新。 扶持一性已通神。 触处露全身。 了了三空无碍，混太虚、体净超尘。 又 志通天地媾精神。 消息葆全真。 造化玄黄极妙，炼九阳、魂变逡巡。 西来祖意坦然伸。 无碍法门亲。 应化河沙周普，露妙圆、糟粕清醇。 又 如如彻底性圆明。 三昧理研精。 纵使头头应显，是一灵、阴魄神情。 玄机须悟志澄清。 丹体鼎煎烹。 养就纯阳法象，性命全、永保无生。 会真集卷之三竟 会真集卷之四
chunks.translated_text:
The Three Marvels’ true creation,
Originally jade-like countenance perfected.
Merging into the treasure vault,
Secretly harboring the nine-turns’ divine elixir.
Defying the sun’s form, majestic in true appearance,
Dwelling in the real realm, vast as boundless heaven.
Let the sun and moon hasten,
Urging the four elements to gradual decay.
All things in their prime cannot endure,
The borrowed body easily lost—
Only that solitary, icy clarity stands firm.
Vast and sacred transformation,
Soaring and dancing, freely singing and strumming.
Accompanied by winds beyond the clouds,
Bright moon in clear sky,
Manifesting myriad hidden and revealed forms.
Returning to youth, never aging,
Facing calamities and kalpas,
The formless spirit abides in peace.

Without worldly thoughts, the firing times unbalanced—
The celestial cycle’s firing times,
Must rise and fall, soar and settle,
Without error or fault.
Qi ascends, piercing the crimson gates,
Breaching the nine heavens with searing heat.
Eyes struggle to open,
Ultimately consumed by fire’s disaster,
Swiftly one must adjust.
Prolonging the years,
Transforms into demonic realms, sinking into ruin.
The six spirits lose control, rampant,
The three corpses run wild,
The five thieves all turn vicious.
To quell the raging flames, return to the jade path,
Deeply enter the spirit palace, vast and open.
The three thieves circulate,
Water and fire intermingle,
Forging the elixir.
Driving them back to rectitude,
Attaining the pure essence of sages and saints.

Autumn in the courtyard—
Perfect Realization:
Yin and yang fully equipped, the Dao’s wind pure.
Essence preserved, celestial truth intact.
Discerning hardness and softness, movement and stillness,
Refining the nine returns, the elixir body renewed.
Upholding the single nature, already spiritually awakened,
Everywhere revealing the whole self.
Lucid in the three voids, unimpeded,
Merging with the great void, the body purified, transcending dust.

Again—
Aspiration pervades heaven and earth, uniting spirit.
The subtle workings preserve perfect truth.
Creation’s mysteries at the ultimate of profound wonder,
Refining the nine yangs, the soul transforms in swift succession.
The Western Patriarch’s intent unfolds with ease,
Intimately embracing the unobstructed Dharma gate.
Responding and transforming universally like the Ganges’ sands,
Revealing wondrous perfection, the essence pure and clear.

Again—
Thusness thoroughly penetrates, nature perfectly luminous.
The samadhi principle deeply refined.
Though all phenomena manifest,
It is but the single spirit—
Yin’s soul and its emotions.
The mysterious mechanism must be awakened, the will clarified.
The elixir body in the cauldron, simmering and boiling.
Nurturing the pure yang’s dharma image,
Nature and life wholly preserved,
Eternally safeguarding the unborn.

*End of Scroll Three of the Collected Writings on Meeting the Real*

chunks.original_text: 超然子王古昌撰 春从天外来 名利如何。 叹六朝七国，五霸山河。 几多兴废，一梦南柯。 光阴暗裹消磨。 悟云山烟水，好归去、策杖披蓑。 任春秋，乐调神养气，行止蹉跎。 家园雪梅火枣，酝玉壶潋滟，满泛金波。 烂饮醺醺，神游云外，真乐自在吟哦。 伴清风明月，通天爽、飞舞婆娑。 泄冲和。 证鸿蒙体段，超彼波罗。 其二 返本修真。 待一阳初动，五气全伸。 金童施义，玉女弘仁。 刚柔消息成姻。 会黄庭仙馆，慧风引、宴拉诸神。 瑞烟浓，泛琼壶雪浪，烹点铅银。 冰肌烂霞帐锦，瘾三奇光射，琼萼清新。 体腻兰香，魂飞羽健，陪从道德为邻。 傲太虚寥廓，真清净、不变长春。 性中珍。 辉十方三界，元迈冰轮。 水调歌头 冲和养真命，神耀破昏衢。 水山明秀，雷泽深处孕玄珠。 七曜北辰枢纽，灿烂金华气结，槁木得重苏。 灵腑风烟静，岳顶月轮孤。 透三天，滋九鼎，饮琼酥。 华胥笑傲，陶陶沉醉玉童扶。 窈窕芝軿鹤驾，驰骤纯阳圣境，宇宙不能拘。 寂阒先天貌，隐显混虚无。 其二 慧风扫魔障，宝剑剿轮回。 内澄神息，驱逐甘露洒灵台。 四象五行三一，聚鼎烟凝橐钥，鼓润发云雷。 水泛金花折，火养玉莲开。 应符数，合九六，契三才。 资成健体，清风明月久追陪。 杳杳冥冥精变，一混希夷道化，神用显恢恢。 仿髴归极乐，咫尺玩蓬莱。 解愁 今古常情，多强侮弱。 蛮触是非成恶。 上天垂孔监，定富贵、理无适莫。 决烈英贤，总不如，访道德、至虚清乐。 旋调燮、木液金晶，九重玉阙，炼玄霜药。 光灼。 满室辉华，显阳 体飞行，变通难约。 放怀明月下，恣酩酊、玉童斟酌。 万籁声清呜管钥。 傲物外、澄澄寥廓。 放祖意独晕，禅天透彻，占得最长生着。 满江红慢 勘破荣华，提智剑、急逃生死。 要黜聪、隳体虚室，内专穷理。 绿水青山成伴侣，清风明月为知己。 得自歌、自乐乐天真，真常美。 胸襟静，神情喜。 从舒卷，恣行止。 肖孤云野鹤，往来难拟。 释氏真风勤整顿，净除诸障如顽鄙。 醒圆明、一点证菩提，功超彼。 其二 志士穷元，凭决烈、豁开尘网。 务理神、和畅真素，内纯恬养。 一气氤氲成造化，九宫上下通来往。 运三光、临照晃乾坤，华英长。 金光灿，心灯朗。 常清浄，绝阿党。 尽头头能显，劫来形像。 非外非中真境露，不生不灭通天爽。 已虚空、打破脱轮回，遐龄享。 烛影摇红　赠高莹蟾 心冷狙徒，志循教父寻宗祖。 上天秘诀始恢弘，冰雪充灵腑。 封闭庚金土釜。 定阴阳、斡旋子午。 应时升降，造化希夷，三光明吐。 性命相资，地天交泰分宾主。 湛然昏默契神功，法像周沙普。 此理君休轻侮。 莫贪爱、纵心踰矩。 一朝功满，三岛同归，名超今古。 其二　警善恶 大道门开，正当甲子天元数。 三清仙院列名科，精选须超度。 此出幽人理悟。 弃荣华、净云不顾。 凿开圆觉，打破虚空，梯登云路。 爱海愚流，乐归觳鱿沉诸趣。 冥冥深夜昧三光，手足浑无措。 缧绁酆都难诉。 恨修迟、迷途失步。 相跻真境，动扯清风，何时能遇。 绣定针 道忠告。

**Spring Comes from Beyond the Heavens**

Fame and profit—what are they?
Sigh for the Six Dynasties, the Seven Kingdoms,
The Five Hegemons’ rivers and mountains.
How many rises and falls,
But a dream in Nanke.
Time silently wears all away.
Awakened to misty mountains and flowing waters,
I long to return—
Staff in hand, straw cloak donned.
Let the seasons pass,
Delighting in nurturing spirit and cultivating qi,
Whether moving or still, all is leisurely drift.

At home, snow on the plum, fire on the jujube,
Brewing a jade flask’s shimmering waves,
Filling it with golden ripples.
Drinking to blissful intoxication,
Spirit soaring beyond the clouds,
True joy arises in carefree chanting.
Accompanied by the clear wind and bright moon,
Through the heavens’ clarity,
Dancing and whirling in freedom.
Releasing harmonious qi,
Attaining the primordial body’s form,
Transcending the farthest shores.

**II**

Returning to the root, cultivating the real.
Awaiting the first stir of yang,
The five qi fully extended.
The Golden Lad bestows righteousness,
The Jade Maiden spreads benevolence.
Hard and soft harmonize in union.
Gathering in the Yellow Court’s immortal hall,
Wisdom’s wind guides,
Feasting with all spirits.
Auspicious mist thickens,
Floating in the jade flask’s snowy waves,
Refining and infusing lead and silver.

Skin like ice, radiant in rosy curtains,
Intoxicated by the three wonders’ light,
Jade petals fresh and pure.
Body smooth as orchid fragrance,
Soul soaring on feathered wings,
Keeping company with Dao and virtue.
Proud in the vast emptiness,
Truly pure and still,
Unchanging, ever-spring.
The treasure within nature
Illumines the ten directions and three realms,
Transcending the icy moon.

---

**Water Melody**

Nurturing the true life with harmony,
Spirit’s radiance shatters the murky paths.
Amidst bright mountains and waters,
In the depths of Thunder Marsh, the mysterious pearl gestates.
The Seven Luminaries pivot around the Northern Star,
Resplendent golden flower qi congeals,
Withered wood revives anew.
The numinous viscera, wind and mist stilled,
At the mountain’s peak, the moon’s wheel stands alone.

Piercing the three heavens,
Nourishing the nine cauldrons,
Drinking the jade nectar.
In Huaxu’s realm, laughing and carefree,
Deeply intoxicated, jade lads lend support.
Graceful as the magic mushroom chariot, crane-drawn,
Galloping through the pure yang’s sacred realm,
Even the cosmos cannot confine.
The serene, precelestial visage,
Manifest or hidden, merges with emptiness.

**II**

Wisdom’s wind sweeps away demonic obstructions,
The sacred sword severs the wheel of rebirth.
Within, spirit and breath settle,
Driving forth sweet dew to sprinkle the numinous terrace.
The four images, five phases, and three-in-one
Gather in the cauldron, mist thickening like bellows’ key,
Stirring clouds and thunder to life.
Water cradles golden blossoms,
Fire nurtures jade lotuses to bloom.

Aligning with celestial patterns,
Harmonizing nine and six,
Uniting the three powers.
Aiding the formation of a robust body,
Clear wind and bright moon as eternal companions.
In the profound and obscure, essence transforms,
Merging into the formless Dao’s alchemy,
Spirit’s function vast and boundless.
Seemingly returning to ultimate bliss,
In an instant, savoring Penglai.

---

**Dispelling Sorrow**

Through the ages, the common way:
The strong often bully the weak.
Ants’ quarrels breed strife and evil.
Heaven watches through the eye of Confucius,
Determining wealth and nobility—
No principle is arbitrary.
The resolute and heroic,
None compare to those who seek Dao,
Embracing utmost emptiness and pure joy.
Swiftly harmonizing wood’s liquid and metal’s essence,
Within the nine-tiered jade palace,
Refining the mysterious frost elixir.

Radiant,
The chamber gleams with splendor,
The yang body takes flight,
Transforming beyond all bounds.
Releasing the heart beneath the bright moon,
Indulging in intoxication,
Jade lads pour the wine.
All sounds—whistling winds and pipes—
Resound in clarity.
Proud beyond the mundane,
In the vast and serene expanse,
The ancestral intent shines alone,
Zen’s heavens thoroughly penetrated,
Securing the path to longest life.

---

**Slow River of Crimson**

Seeing through glory and splendor,
Wielding wisdom’s sword,
Swiftly fleeing life and death.
Cast aside cleverness,
Shatter the body, empty the chamber,
Inwardly delve into principle.
Green waters and blue mountains as companions,
Clear wind and bright moon as confidants.
Singing and rejoicing in the celestial truth,
The beauty of the eternal real.

Heart serene,
Spirit joyful.
Flowing freely,
Moving or still at will.
Like a solitary cloud or wild crane,
Coming and going beyond measure.
The true wind of Śākya earnestly tended,
Cleansing all hindrances, coarse and base.
Awakening to perfect clarity,
A single point realizes bodhi,
Surpassing all merit.

**II**

The steadfast scholar, delving into the origin,
Relies on resolute determination,
Breaking free from the dusty net.
Focusing on spirit,
Harmonizing the true and plain,
Inwardly pure and tranquil.
One qi, misty and vast, creates transformation,
The nine palaces above and below connect in flow.
The three lights descend to illuminate heaven and earth,
Everlasting splendor.

Golden light resplendent,
The heart’s lamp bright.
Ever pure and still,
Free from partiality.
In every instance, the true form manifests,
Through kalpas, its image endures.
Neither within nor without, the true realm revealed,
Unborn and undying, penetrating celestial clarity.
Having shattered the void,
Escaping the wheel of rebirth,
Enjoying longevity without end.

---

**Candlelight Sways Red: For Gao Yingchan**

Heart cold toward schemers,
Will follows the teaching father to seek the ancestral root.
Heaven’s secret art first expands,
Ice and snow fill the numinous viscera.
Sealing the metal and earth cauldron,
Regulating yin and yang,
Revolving the cycles of zi and wu.
Rising and descending in due time,
Creation’s mystery, the formless,
The three lights radiantly emerge.

Life and nature mutually sustain,
Heaven and earth harmonize, roles defined.
In profound stillness, merging with spirit’s work,
The dharma image pervades the sands.
This principle—do not slight it,
Nor indulge desires, transgressing bounds.
One day, merit complete,
Returning to the three isles together,
Name surpassing past and present.

**II: Warning of Good and Evil**

The Dao’s gate opens,
At the destined moment of jiazi’s celestial origin.
The Three Pure Ones’ immortal courts list the names,
Refinement must transcend the ordinary.
This is the hidden one’s awakened truth,
Abandoning glory, pure clouds unattended.
Carving open perfect enlightenment,
Shattering the void,
Climbing the ladder to the cloud path.

Foolish streams lost in the sea of desire,
Delighting in the husk’s return to myriad destinies.
In the darkest night, the three lights obscured,
Hands and feet utterly at a loss.
Bound in Fengdu’s chains, no recourse,
Regretting delayed cultivation,
Lost on the path, steps misplaced.
When will they ascend to the true realm,
Riding the clear wind,
Encountering it at last?

---

**Embroidered Needle: A Loyal Admonition**

chunks.translated_text:
**Reflecting on the Futile Striving to Shoot Down the Sun**

Aspiring to shoot the sun and turn back heaven’s course,
Yet all ends in vain exhaustion.
Buried through eons untold,
Once fame, profit, *qi*, and wealth are seen through,
Their lingering winds swept clean in a single stroke.
A heart of pure integrity remains.
Comprehending the three thieves within,
One steers the stars and constellations,
Guides the Silver River’s turning,
Yet pours waves over the elixir crucible.
Mysterious and yellow *qi* lead the way,
Binding earth’s marrow and heaven’s essence,
Suddenly soaring, then tumbling in chaos.
Refining jade, smelting gold,
Spirit transforms into utter emptiness,
The body merges with the profound mystery of *xi yi*.
Rising high on iridescent clouds,
Revealing the wondrous form,
Abiding in true emptiness with eternal pride.
Such flavors of the Way—
Yet worldly folk, though near, never attain.

**II: Brewing the Golden Elixir**

Irrigating the three fields above and below,
Washing away eons of dust in a single rinse.
Nurturing the vastness like Yan Hui’s master,
Embracing poverty’s joy, admiring Yan Hui’s ease,
Floating on lakes like Fan Li’s light skiff.
Within, one unfolds magnanimity and harmony,
Reveling in the wondrous garden,
Where the Dao’s winds flourish abundantly.
Purifying the heart’s illumination,
Never straying from oneness,
Embracing softness and following ritual.
The breast brims with cloud-capped majesty,
Stealing the moon palace’s toad essence,
The sun palace’s crow marrow.
These two substances mutually nourish,
Refining jade frost and cinnabar,
Filling the chamber with cinnabar radiance.
Transforming into a mysterious body,
Surely becoming the primal yang soul’s leader.
Treading the wind, transcending,
Not dwelling in the nine heavens’ bounds.

**Water Dragon’s Chant: Harmonious Nurturing Following Heaven’s Numbers**

Silently aligning with the celestial cycles,
Unseen, it entwines the revolving measures.
Yin and yang’s longing forms,
Wind, thunder, clouds, and lightning,
Congeal to bring forth timely rains.
Droplet by droplet, the numinous source pours,
Irrigating all,
Yet old dust cannot defile.
The winding river gleams pure,
Crows seize the jade hare,
Osmanthus branches bloom,
Spilling crimson mists.
The two *qi* blend and gather,
Scattering golden light,
Three mountains densely arrayed.
Tempering a robust body,
A youthful visage moistened,
With ample leisure to soar.
Spirit transcends the mundane,
Beyond the dust, in pristine clarity,
The true countenance fully revealed.
This is the kalpa’s one thread,
A living craft through heaven,
Awaiting each person’s awakening.

**II: Heaven and Earth’s Judgment of Yin and Yang’s Positions**

Primal simplicity scatters, *qi* swirls to form vessels.
The mother’s womb holds the child’s belly,
The child is born of the mother,
Mysteriously parting auspicious signs.
The body refines into purity,
Expanding the spirit’s chamber,
Clouds recede, dust burdens lifted.
Wind clears, moon brightens,
Golden youths dance,
Reveling on Mount Jia,
Scenes wondrous and strange.
Returning from the feast, deeply intoxicated,
Arriving at Hua Xu,
Yet the jade pass remains barred.
Splitting the jade curtain,
The host invites me,
Secretly transmitting the ancestral intent.
How could there be three voids?
The body manifests purity,
Perfect clarity, non-dual.
Freely roaming, unbound,
Unentangled, unshackled,
Like the vast emptiness itself.

**III: Wisdom Sweeps Away the Thicket, Opening the Heart-Ground**

*Qi* nurtures, *qi* swirls in purity.
The three wonders gather in the crucible,
Within the blazing fire,
The elixir flower blooms auspiciously.
From the sea’s depths, a clear breeze rises,
Exotic fragrance sprays,
Lush and rich in form.
Wooden lads playfully tease,
Soaring unimpeded,
Adorned by jewel-bright light,
Flames of rosy clouds ablaze.
The secret chamber, cool and ever-charming,
Expands the breast,
Bathed in frost’s radiance.
Smoke vanishes, fire extinguishes,
Clouds recede, mists disperse,
Instantly becoming non-dual.
With towering presence, carefree,
Affairs merge with river sands,
Light and dust undifferentiated.
This primal wondrous existence,
The pure and empty Dharma-body,
Attains the bodhisattva’s rank.

**IV: The Perfected One Grasps the Handle of Cultivating Truth**

Beyond the ordinary, delving into the profound words’ ultimate meaning.
Limpid, deep contemplation,
Unbroken, perfect breath,
*Qi* swirls in true nature.
A single fusion with the blazing wind’s force,
Five gates open,
Three wonders’ light converges.
At the time of fullness and emptiness,
Yin and yang transform toward peace,
Revealing the true creation,
Harmonizing with heaven’s mandate.
Composing the spirit’s centeredness,
Manifesting eternal spring,
Wind and light towering and distant.
Myriad strands of rosy clouds,
A range of misty peaks,
Fill the sky with clarity.
Distant and near pavilions,
Reflecting cloud-borne steps,
Carefree in song and chant.
Reveling in the cool Dharma-realm,
At ease in life’s craft,
Attaining the saint of non-action.

**Auspicious Crane Immortal: Cherishing the Heart’s Devotion to Simplicity**

Inwardly revering plainness and frugality,
Drifting like duckweed,
Footprints lost in waves of sinking.
Wisdom and brilliance never employed,
Recalling riches that shake the heavens,
Mistaken dreams startling one awake.
Fiercely severing the cords of desire,
Seeking the leisure of true winds,
Graceful and ample.
The valley spirit at peace,
Breath slows, connecting to truth,
The primal *qi* stirs the bellows’ key.
Spending freely from jade crucible and golden tripod,
Fire billows, clouds surge,
Mysteriously conceiving the elixir medicine.
Spirit and soul refined,
Becoming pure and vast in form.
Toward the profound and boundless,
Penetrating the pot’s heaven,
Grasping the joy of cool winds and ease.
Merging with emptiness,
Truly pure, truly clear,
Resolving the one move of emptiness.

**Eternal Joy: Wondrous Alignment with Heaven’s Wheel**

Mastering the celestial wheel,
Turning the pivot of the seven governors,
The jade balance revolves.
Silently operating ascent and descent,
Pushing to the limits of creation,
A single *qi* transforms the three wonders.
Tortoise essence, toad marrow,
Phoenix fluid, crow blood,
Boiling in the crucible’s rolling brew.
The mysterious pearl forms,
Golden medicine fresh and radiant,
Spewing forth nine dragons’ lightning.
The infant enters the golden chamber,
The maiden returns to the silver palace,
Pipes and songs crowd the pure feast.
Kingfisher curtains lowered,
Pearl blinds rolled up,
Joyous auspicious clouds displayed.
Ice-cold, the sky vast,
Wind clear, moon bright,
Revealing the original face.
Perfect emptiness expands,
Unobstructed spiritual powers,
Scattering through the great void.

**II: Snail-Horn Merit, Fly-Head Profit**

Snail-horn merit,
Fly-head profit,
Swept away with a sigh.
With a flick of the hand, wielding the blade,
Cleaving open the pass’s essentials,
Within, the mysterious origin revealed.
Delusive clouds crumble,
Zen’s heaven glistens like ice,
Instantly the moon shines, winds sway.
Stamping a thousand streams,
Green waters limpid,
Universally bathing in one luminous vessel.
Standing alone, resolute,
A model of perfect fusion,
Near and far, undisturbed in oneness.
Coming and going distinctly,
All dualities dissolved,
Auspicious signs of the yang soul appear.
The cool other shore,
A wondrous, lively craft,
Sitting beyond, jade flowers gracefully bloom.
Towering, attaining
The flawless merit’s completion,
The saint’s mechanism fully realized.

**III: The Wisdom Sword’s Unyielding Edge**

The wisdom sword’s unyielding edge,
A hundred demons swept away,
Terrifying hearts and gall.
Fierce tigers captured alive,
Flood dragons seized in hand,
Unleashing awe-inspiring transformations.
Thunder drums roar,
Serpents fly like golden lightning,
Billowing clouds spew hailstones.
Through rivers and seas,
Tidal waves surge,
Two beasts locked in mortal combat.

chunks.translated_text:
**III: The Three Peaks’ Fiery Advance**

The three peaks’ fire advances,
Nine heavens’ rosy clouds dazzle,
Enveloping the treasure trove’s radiant display.
A thousand auspicious hues,
A single speck of gold,
The crucible and cauldron refine ceaselessly.
Simmered into jade-like pistils,
Skin like snow,
The jade person’s visage emerges.
The Wooden Lad rejoices,
Drawing near to return,
Exotic fragrance fills the courtyard.

**IV: The Qi’s Profound Mist**

Qi’s profound mist swirls,
Revolving the cosmos,
Myriad wondrous transformations arise.
Creation’s rise and fall,
East and west inverted,
Metal and Wood in tender affection.
A thousand crimson rosy strands,
A single golden radiance shines—
Surely the sun returns to the Toad Palace.
Exotic fragrance enhances,
Cassia blooms contend in splendor,
Six yin and nine yang engage in battle.
Clouds gather, rain scatters,
Wind clears, moon brightens,
The erstwhile visage reappears.
In stillness, tranquility deepens,
In leisure, contemplation settles,
The dharma realm joins in revelry.
The sparse net spans the Silver River,
Iron walls’ gates unlock,
Concealment and manifestation shift unseen.
Within nothingness, being stirs—
Body merged with river sands,
The wondrous field’s karma excels.

**The Resplendent Divine Light**

Sorrow and joy, thoughts stilled,
Movement and stillness, the heart hollowed,
No one in the vast wilds—boundless expanse.
Verdant qi harmonizes,
Skillful brew stirs wind and thunder.
Unfolding heaven and earth’s grand transformation,
As sweet rain,
Dharma seeds bloom into lotuses.
Auspicious signs appear,
Toward the Yellow Court’s brocade canopy,
The divine embryo wondrously forms.
Misty auspicious light envelops the body,
Bathed in the Nine Dragons’ waters,
Borne aloft to the Jasper Terrace.
Laughing in eternal spring,
Pipes and songs escort the golden kalpa.
Scenes cluster like resplendent jade blossoms,
Drunken, riding the wind,
Soaring and lingering in flight.
Attaining true joy,
The path ahead—birth and death self-destroy.

**II: The Divine Work’s Creation**

Divine work forges creation,
Revolving heaven’s pivot,
In leisure, silently aligning true cultivation.
Illuminating the Three Lights,
Shifting the Five Qi’s ebb and flow.
The Northern Dipper and Southern Stars encircle,
Rolling the Silver River,
Myriad streams surge in waves.
The Jade Pass opens,
Conveying the three chariots in ceaseless motion,
Together harnessing the Golden Ox.
Thunderclaps shake the cosmos,
Crimson light bursts through mountains and rivers,
Lightning flashes without end.
Spreading the Yellow Sprout,
Rosy clouds veil phoenix towers and dragon halls.
A priceless flawless pearl congeals,
The Wooden Lad rejoices,
Secretly securing the treasure.
In this form,
Drawn through emptiness to the fruition’s end.

**Southern Song Lyrics**

**I**
The cave’s lock tames the docile ape,
The reins restrain the unruly horse.
Qi congeals, spirit gathers—emptiness perfected.
Eons’ clouds disperse,
Proudly mastering one’s own heaven.
Bright moon, clear wind—refreshing,
Auspicious light veils the sacred lotus.
Wooden man and stone maiden discourse on the profound.
Transformative divine powers,
Beyond the mundane—attaining Golden Immortality.

**II**
Firmly rooted, the mechanism’s handle,
Deeply planted, the transformative power.
Plucking flowers, gathering leaves—all defilements dissolved.
Nurturing harmony’s surge,
Above and below, threading the Three Fields.
Riverbanks harmonize with crow and hare,
The cinnabar furnace cooks mercury and lead.
Counting the ninefold perfection of sacred work.
The body permeated with golden light,
Shimmering, illuminating the dhyāna heavens.

**III**
Utterly stilling thoughts, driving away all foulness,
Clarifying the heart, eradicating myriad ties.
The inner pivot’s bellows and keys—breath ceaseless.
One thread through the Three Palaces,
Warp and weft align with the celestial circuit.
Fire’s warmth tempers the golden crucible,
Brightly following the six hundred chapters.
Simmered into the sixteenfold body’s roundness.
Veiled and gleaming auspicious light,
Graceful, proudly soaring as a flying immortal.

**IV**
The candle ignites the heart’s radiance,
Clouds disperse, the moon of nature shines.
A flask of ice-like clarity, wind’s might roused.
Myriad forms interweave,
The Dipper’s handle revolves the celestial sphere.
Creation’s principle of non-action,
Vast and boundless, the Dao’s transformation towering.
In profound obscurity, aligning with heaven’s mechanism.
The hawk’s divine work,
The dharma realm steps upon clouds to return.

**V**
The numinous viscera cleansed of all dust,
The people’s mountain—qi’s singular birth.
The Three Fields plowed day and night by the iron ox.
Stirring wind and thunder’s moisture,
The golden well ever blooms with jade blossoms.
Fire’s power adjusted with care,
Frost-like skin simmered in season.
Round and bright, the square inch—ghosts and spirits startled.
Joyous immortal lads,
Feasting at will, soaring in flight.

**VI**
Supreme rank’s lightness and luxury,
Golden seals arrayed in mighty cauldrons.
Heaven-shaking renown—fleeting in its moment.
Lightning turns, stars fly,
The body vanishes, qi follows the wind.
Spitting at past clumsiness,
Feigning foolishness, not feigning wisdom.
The true yang’s essence—urgently cultivate and honor.
Nine nines’ work perfected,
Strolling at ease through Penglai’s palace.

**VII**
The great elixir gathered in the southwest,
Harmonized in the northeast’s corner.
Fire dragon and water tiger stir in heaven’s thoroughfare.
The Seven Governors’ pivotal mechanism?
Revolving, dispensing jade-like nectar.
The moon’s grotto sprays musk’s fragrance,
The water flask offers pearls of jade.
The Golden Lad plays and presents at the immortals’ capital.
Heaven’s countenance delights,
Granting a lifespan equal to emptiness.

**VIII**

**III: The Wisdom Sword’s Unyielding Edge**

The wisdom sword’s unyielding edge,
A hundred demons swept away,
Terrifying hearts and gall.
Fierce tigers captured alive,
Flood dragons seized in hand,
Unleashing awe-inspiring transformations.
Thunder drums roar,
Serpents fly like golden lightning,
Billowing clouds spew hailstones.
Through rivers and seas,
Tidal waves surge,
Two beasts locked in mortal combat.

Qi pierces the autumn light’s chill,
The breast harbors winds of radiant hue.
The body soars, twisting free from the Dragon Palace,
Hastening to the Orchid Court,
Where youth’s years rejoice in harmony.

Riding the tiger through limpid streams,
Driving the crow ‘neath the moon’s bright glow.
The cauldron’s work complete, the elixir perfected,
Wielding divine powers at will,
Unfettered, scorning the true void.

*Jiang Mei Yin*
The dark pearl spits auspicious lightning, flying bright.
Piercing the curtains, circling the celestial sphere.
The Yellow River’s flow reversed,
Wind and waves surge with divine might.

After midnight, the six yin lines descend once more,
The seventh return achieved—
The immortal lad dons his feathered robe.
Vast and serene, nurturing the towering Dao,
The host knows no resistance,
The guest returns in kind.

No trace of the primal beginning,
Yet the ten thousand images’ realm lingers dim.
Plunged into stillness, ever silent,
The whole body revealed,
Witnessing the vast chaos—
A single gleam.

**IX**
Mad apes and clumsy horses—debates on cultivating the true.
Most arduous,
The Dao hard to embrace.
Only the clear-eyed,
Generous, cast off the dust of the mortal world.

Toppling the mountain of gratitude, the heart shatters,
Delighting in rivers and clouds,
Taking refuge where virtue has neighbors.

The true union of Kan and Li nurtures the primordial spirit.
By the winding river’s edge,
The elixir sprouts anew.
Fermented in the jade field,

Behold the majesty of the nine yangs—
The mysterious body robust,
Wielding the dharma-realm,
Manifesting the towering,
Pure transformation of the Dao.

**X**
Yellow robes, primal fortune—
The golden winds unfurl.

Striking the sparse paulownia, driving back the fading red.

In ceaseless toil, the time comes for the western decree to dawn—
Yellow chrysanthemums bloom,
Autumn’s fragrance fills the jade grove.

Ascending the heights, the sacred assembly’s joy knows no end.

A crisp qi fills the breast,

Lofty and without action, true joy arises,

**XI**
Ignorance gnawed through, the契 of true cultivation.
Passing spring and autumn,

The wondrous mechanism of life and nature merges in harmony.
Two entwined,

The profound true void,

Boundless transformation, neither inner nor outer—

*To the Tune of "Picking Mulberries"*

Unchanging, ever-spring.
The ancestral intent made manifest,

The pearl of nature gleams, clear as the moon over the dhyāna heavens.

Fragrance suffuses her being.
Musk sprays the bright hall,
Through kalpas, the ancestral wind and Dao’s transformation flourish.

**III**
Wisdom’s light pierces through the coarse heart’s dross,
Severing thought, forgetting emotion.
Form still, spirit clear—
She cradles forth the perfect emptiness, a single gleam of brightness.

Sweeping clouds, dispelling mist, her divine mechanism triumphs,
Roaming free in all directions.
True form defies naming—
She brandishes radiance, illuminating the eight reaches.

**IV**
The pivot of will moves through stillness and motion, diligent from dawn to dusk,
Delighting in hardship and obscurity.
Subtle signs interflow,
Bellows and keys breathe in harmony with the Great Void.

The craftsman forges the body of pure yang through subdued fire,
Dharma realms merge in emptiness.
The true work of creation—
The cosmos entire returns to her grasp.

*To the Tune of "Green-Headed Duck"*
The Dao’s wind pure,
Martial curtains intertwine in ceaseless weaving.
Gathering the three heavens, harmonizing the two lands,
Revolving the primal palace—true qi flows.

Transforming hardness and softness, dragon and mare roam,
Responding to the seventy-two seasonal nodes.
Jade runs, gold flies,
Smoke spouts, mist is drawn—
Water and fire swiftly meet in union.

The six yin disperse, the three yang gather in the cauldron,
The elixir’s essence blooms in splendor.
Fragrant winds attend, golden light suffuses her form,
A few strands of rosy dawn gleam.

Suddenly the foundation opens—
Nature manifests in every detail,
Penetrating the great thousandfold worlds in all directions.
A gentle breeze carries her, soaring and leaping,
Treading the clouds, her bearing majestic.

Neither form nor emptiness,
Neither increase nor decrease—
The ocean’s treasure, the wish-fulfilling gem, emits true crystal.
Within and without, radiance flows unimpeded,
Her divine powers welcome the six penetrations.

Her primordial visage—
Work accomplished, vast and boundless,
Beyond all naming.

**II**
Her body rare and subtle,
The mysterious female of the valley-spirit as foundation.
Qi coils back through three thousand six hundred turns,
Tracing the twin passes—wind and waves ripple.

Around the golden city, the mud ox drags the phoenix,
Across the jade path, the wooden horse consults the tortoise.
Seven returns to the true,
Nine restorations of life—
The sacred embryo forms, auspicious mist suffuses.

Reciting prajñā, she strays not from samādhi,
Attaining the shore, she realizes non-action.
Beyond the true realm—
Crimson light and white radiance,
Entering and exiting, ever attendant.

The grotto-heaven gleams, pure and serene,
Her yang soul races lightly, swiftly as the wind.
She wields the spirit’s brilliance, boundless and resplendent,
Her countenance through the ages shines in full glory.

The wind of purity, the life of emptiness,
A vast and sudden point—utterly unblemished.
Unleashing the sacred transformation, penetrating heaven and earth,
The pearl reveals its mani-jewel.

Thus and thus, soaring and still—
Everywhere, the jade pools.

*To the Tune of "Drizzling Rain"*
The myriad conditions—her heart rests.

Master Chaoran Wang Jichang’s *Manjianghong*

That primal spark—
from the first, beyond birth and extinction.
Yet chasing shadows, it falls into yin and yang,
shaped into form, its face and features ever-changing.
In this turbid age of five defilements,
the eight sufferings press and sear—
born, then dead; dead, then born again,
when will this cycle of birth and death end?

I teach you awakening,
your will seizing the mystery of the Yellow and the Dark.
The seven luminaries thread the three wonders,
the pivot of the pearl and the jade wheel stirs, qi flowing.
Nine returns, seven reversals,
the elixir timed and tempered—
in the golden cavern, jade blossoms unfurl,
five qi soaring as crimson snow.

*Drunken Ecstasy*
Nourish the vast with fasting heart.
The true work of the five phases overturned—
a divine wind rises and falls through the three isles of teeth.
The merit aligns with the celestial circuit,
the True One embraced within.

Form sustains the formless Dao,
the passionless brews the treasure of passion.
Upholding the body’s health, the spirit endures forever.
Alone, the dhyāna heavens revealed,
the heart illumined by the moon’s bright radiance.

*The Golden Goblet*
Lock the monkey-mind,
thoughts sinking deep.
In profound obscurity, the subtle mechanism turns—
southern fire, northern abyss of metal.
Open the mercury crucible, tiger and dragon roar.
Nourish the nine qi, strip away the host of yin.
Pour the wine diligently, the wind-harp’s melody.
Send off the wooden lad with a great draught of drunkenness.
The six viscera flow, the five spirits feast.
Cross into the sage’s realm, shed the mortal garb.
The pure and tranquil body—
even ghosts and gods revere it.

*Second Stanza*
Preserve the celestial true,
nurture the primordial spirit.
Harmonize the two substances, brew the eastern sun’s wine.
Follow heaven’s reckoning, respond to the hour.
Withdraw and replenish with care, rise at *gengshen*.
Refine the mercury medicine, smelt the lead and silver.
Eight jades renewed, the snow-flesh even.
Crimson clouds blanket the earth, fragrant winds stir.
The guest from the west—
his intent pure and refined.
In the dream of *Huaxu*, dreaming through spring,
he returns beyond things, revealing his whole body.

*Third Stanza*

chunks.translated_text:
**Knock at the Mystic Pass, tread the clouded peaks.**
Flower-glow and stone-luster, pine-winds soft.
The zither dispels vexation, wine unfolds the face.
The heart’s truth soars free, the mind at ease.
All realms dissolve—I alone endure.
Nine suns return, six yins are pared away.
Gather the eight treasures, golden light brims full.
The body fuses and shines, rosy clouds deepen.
Form and reality merge, the Great Void unbroken.
Welcome the immortal guest, transcend the dusty world.

*Fourth Stanza*
Sever dust-bound passions, wisdom’s wind arises.
Heaven’s gate and earth’s pivot serve as levers.
The mystic mechanism turns, the Dipper’s hub revolves.
Toad marrow, sun-crow essence—
*ren*-palace gathers, jade crucible refines.
Lush blossoms bloom, the ten thousand spirits grow clear.
Three Terraces and Six Auxiliaries celebrate in the celestial palace.
Feast on jade nectar, ferment the true essence.
Return to the sea of awakening, merge into perfect completion.
Behold the sovereign self—majestic in form.

*Fifth Stanza*
Emerald mists clear, ripples pure.
Light drifts o’er the thatched hut, pine windows still.
At dusk, I don my robe, the zither across my lap.
Idle chanting, content in true feeling.
Poverty brings joy—greater than duke or minister.
Favor brings no pride, disgrace no alarm.
The numinous terrace nurtures, the balance shifts.
Zen moon serene, the nature-pearl bright.
Samādhi unravels, the six penetrations refined.
The supreme Dao—attained in perfect completion.

---

**Drunk in Penglai**
The primal form, one qi, thrones divide heaven and earth,
Uncarved simplicity reveals its auspice.
Through boundless kalpas, none escape—
ensnared by yin and yang’s weave.
Sudden awakening turns back, light harmonizes gold,
Wood clusters *kan* and *li*’s essence.
Miasma winds howl, clouds drift, rain descends—
the elixir’s foundation evenly steeped.
Nine gatherings, three epochs, six lines’ numbers fulfilled,
Odd and even multiply, the Valley Spirit leaves its vessel.
Piercing Kunlun’s summit, I seize the clear wind in play.
Reclining at ease, white clouds amass,
lost in blissful drunkenness.
Seeing through emptiness, movement and stillness graceful,
the spirit-pearl grants every wish.

---

**Drunk on the River Moon**
Primal qi swirls through the celestial pivot,
the Dipper’s handle turns the starry vault.
Sun and moon entwine, advancing and retreating,
fixing dawn, dusk, crescent, and full.
The four seasons cycle, yin and yang harmonize—
creation’s work supreme.
Vast and luminous, it crafts the myriad forms in perfect accord.
Divine function cleaves heaven and earth,
generation responds to the seasons—
the work of seven and nine converges.
Tiger coils, dragon coils, their roars a melody,
the riverbank’s voice wails in wind and wave.
Nurturing the divine embryo, surging in sacred transformation,
the Dharma-realm’s true nature unfurls.
The pearl in darkness gleams,
its radiant image boundless unfolds.

*Second Stanza*
The true heart, a hand’s breadth,
embraces the Great Ultimate, divides auspice,
mystic and yellow intertwine.
Within creation’s midst, the sage’s message—
sun and moon, tiger and dragon arrayed.
Beneath the crucible, crimson light,
diligently the civil and martial alternate,
advancing and retreating by the hour.
Refined into golden pistils,
the elixir’s body, ice-pure, densely clustered.
In the land of harmony, people rest,
the Heavenly Root silently aligns,
profound stillness delights in true suchness.
The pearl’s crystal light shoots through Ox and Dipper,
its bright radiance keen as frost and snow.
Ten thousand kalpas’ clouds gather,
lifetimes’ dust settles—
the heart’s dharma wholly extinguished in duality.
No words suffice—
suddenly, the bottom drops away, clarity dawns.

---

**Southern Village Song**
Duckweed and driftwood traverse heaven’s edge.
Cast off burdens, hollow out passions—all things void.
Rinsing stones, pillowing streams, sweetly nurturing vastness,
toiling diligently.
Plucking tortoise and snake, place them in the jade crucible.
Black waters yield golden pearls.
On winding shores, red frost moistens, anoints the soft.
The body’s crucible molds inch-long pellets—
the elixir’s wonder, without care.
Galloping through divine powers, the sun-and-moon flask.

*Second Stanza*
