chunks.translated_text:
*The Great Dao in the Three Fields*

The Great Dao abides in the Three Fields—
know the One, then cease clinging to one side.
Through the two realms it flows within the square inch,
profound and mysterious—
the Three-in-One shapes form before the Emperor’s origin.

The deeper one drills, the more unyielding it grows;
the higher one gazes, the more boundless its transforming power.
Sight and hearing fail to grasp the limitless intent—
emptiness perfected.
Its wondrous body shines through ancient and present, whole and complete.

*Stay, Guest—*
*Awaken to arising and ceasing.*
In a sudden stroke, sever the wild horse’s frenzy and the monkey’s folly.
All conditions released at once,
one feels the true secret of the mysterious and yellow.
Returning to refuge, the heart is washed clean—
all is harmonized in balance.

The work of yin and yang blazes fierce.
Inhaling essence, absorbing purity,
one steals from the Void—
true beauty nurtures the seemingly dull.
Distinctions fade.
Qi meets spirit in communion,
forgetting form in true delight.
The ear is filled with pure sound,
a myriad streams in the silent void sigh deep.
The solitary yang transforms into an immortal realm,
offering forth immaculate whiteness.
Wind and light—pristine as ice and jade.
The spirit soars beyond things, roaming freely,
treading the void in pristine clarity.

Descending to the center,
one steals the harmonious qi of heaven and earth—
the foundation of the elixir’s creation.
The Mysterious Female assists the pivot of the mechanism.
Four Images and Three Wonders—
the ebb and flow of fortune and adversity,
lead and mercury drawn forth from Kan and Li.
Advancing and retreating in cycles,
the Jade Gate’s wind blows through the nine heavens.
Clouds move, rain falls,
irrigating the yellow sprout’s snowy flesh.
Five hues rise in radiant shade,
the fragrant beauty of two eights.
The Six Yang cauldron seethes,
firing times follow the celestial cycles.
Nurturing form to wholeness,
mist gathers, clouds withdraw—entering non-doing.

*Second Stanza*

Vast and profound, the spirit clear, the nature pure,
the body vigorous, lightly soaring.
Boundless, resplendent—light takes flight.
Moonlike, it dons the radiance of Li.
In a flourish, a thousand spirits shift in form,
wherever touched, each reveals its proper aspect.
Wisdom dispels delusion,
the breast claps with icy clarity—bound for Jasper Pool.
Auspicious guests gather in feast,
scattering rare fragrance,
mist curling within crimson curtains.
Joyous music accompanies,
celebrating with divine delight.
The unborn body’s state—
laughing freely, returning to the true realm’s favor.
Through kalpas, perfect illumination,
urging beyond the supreme, into the formless.

*Gazing Toward Penglai*

Pushing forth wondrous principle,
concealing function, manifesting through benevolence.
The spirit settled in profound darkness, heaven and earth merge—
doubt not the pure breeze of indistinct enlightenment.
The five qi preserve celestial truth.
The golden crucible seethes,
brilliant as newly wrought jade.
Nurtured through kalpas, the unimpeded form arises,
the three awakenings of the numinous source verify the whole body.
Pure and clear, the rabbit escapes sinking.

*Second Stanza*

The spirit stilled for long,
its workings enter non-doing.
All day, one fears lest it show the slightest sign—
like an infant, moving and resting in joyous ease.
Necessarily firm, the heart departs all.

No cutting off delusion,
yet truth requires no cultivation.
The hearts of truth and delusion belong to dust’s veil—
when the veil of dust is unstained, the nature is formless.
The pearl gleams, the mani jewel revealed.

*Third Stanza*
chunks.overlap_context:
lotus rising from water.

*Fourth Stanza*

Silent as one who seems foolish,
a single qi swirls in the sun-and-moon crucible.
The mysterious female drives the meeting of the three natures—
congealing into softness.
Drunk on intoxication, the nature delights in itself.

Wind and moon cannot restrain it.
Heaven upon heaven turns the Dipper’s pivot.
The subtle workings of yin and yang shape wondrous delight—
joy in emotion.
A single stream of red light shines upon the Great Vastness.

*Fifth Stanza*

chunks.translated_text:
**The Hidden Dragon Moves**

The hidden dragon stirs,
unyielding, coiled in the sea’s abyssal source.
Black mists veil the three passes in deep concealment,
crimson clouds weave through nine winding peaks.
The jade crucible refines the golden elixir.

The precious vase is filled,
snow-white waves surge boundless.
Eight windows, four doors radiate sun and moon,
the six spirits flow free—earth and heaven expand.
The true realm inscribes true joy.

*Fourth Stanza*

True fire turns,
the five viscera’s qi simmer and seethe.
Yang subdues the six yins in hidden transformation,
essence transmutes to marrow, blood to essence.
White milk forms the body anew.

The primal spirit gathers,
at dawn it appears, preserving the body’s glory.
Golden bones replace the form—indestructible,
light scatters in ten thousand strands, radiant as dawn’s glow.
Cloud-steps traverse Penglai’s isles.

**Wuling Spring**

Fire and water intertwine in south and north,
metal and wood exchange west and east.
The embryo coalesces at the source, the imperial flourishing palace.
Through subtle workings, true achievement is wrought.

A steed gallops beyond the three isles,
nine bends, six oxen connect.
The dark pearl ferments, crimson through the body,
light and strong, merging in harmony.

*Second Stanza*

On the yin ridge, the two-eight medicinal sprouts are gathered,
plucked—snow-white golden blossoms.
The four-footed wu-wei crucible forges them,
the three natures unite in true crystal.

From the sea’s depths, breath blows the flameless fire,
tempering through countless refinements.
The ice-flesh is wrought, gleaming as white jade.
The spirit-sage’s visage, unbounded.

*Third Stanza*

The immortal’s Dao—from ancient times to now, it is man himself,
yet you fear your own heart is lost.
You say heaven is high, I say it is low.
Three inches make the ladder to heaven.

Nineteen such men never arrive,
separated as clouds from mud.
The wondrous secret pours forth—if you but trust and act,
merit and power align with heaven.

**Willow Tops Green**

The bitter sea stretches vast, drifting and tossing,
seeming as boundless as the northern ocean’s surging waves.
Multitudes sink, like fish at play,
endlessly chasing, drawn to and fro.

Adrift in throngs, hearts at ease—
how few transform into roc-like forms?
Once they ascend to the celestial pond,
wings spread through the clouds,
instantly transcending the supreme.

**Paired Swallows**

Circling sun and moon,
spring and autumn shift between flourishing and withering—
how many cycles have they woven?
Tang’s courts and Han’s palaces,
Chu’s gardens and Qin’s halls rise and fall.

The sea of love’s currents—what constancy holds them?
All vast and boundless, without birth or stagnation.
Startled awake from the kalpa’s dusty passions,
turning inward, we trace the root and stem.

**Luminous Wisdom**

Embracing the One, we grasp the Three.
The true heart moves heaven and earth,
Kan and Li merge in mutual aid.
Mists coalesce, enclosing,
purple veils and white blossoms guard the gate.

The pearl gestates in profound mystery, resplendent,
refining the spirit, shedding the cloud-soul like a cicada’s husk.
Entering and exiting the formless without hindrance,
permeating the three times in unity.

**Jade Terrace, First Tier**

Heat departs, cold arrives,
borne by the sun and moon’s ceaseless advance and retreat.
Spring and autumn alternate,
withering and flourishing succeed one another—
how many scenes have changed?

Life hurries on,
cutting short the waist, whitening the hair,
all to ninety and beyond.
Yet impermanence comes—
though gold and jade fill the coffers,
no remedy can save.

**Pondering**

Swiftly awaken, turn back with fierce resolve,
clearing the heart’s ground to nurture primordial yang.
Hands grasp heaven and earth,
the body births ten thousand transformations,
soaring through the empty realm.

Death and life are severed,
leaping free from the world’s net—
the true form, cool and clear.
The Dao’s essence flourishes,
attaining the three times with perfect clarity,
through the ages, majestic and bright.

**Moonlight Pure**

A single spark of spirit-light,
a thousand cycles of sinking,
wandering through the four births and six destinies.
Drowning in the bitter sea,
how often do we change our faces?

Chilled by the four great elements—rootless, illusory,
appearing and vanishing like shooting stars or lightning.
Endless—
the strange stench of coming and going,
the withering and flourishing of change.

Seeing through it all, we cling to nothing.
Awakening to the dream-butterfly, the lamp-moth,
we transcend birth’s monopoly.
Tightly sealing the mysterious pass,
tempering the inch-heart through a thousand refinements.

Refined, the primal origin’s purity is revealed,
expanding into earth, ascending into heaven—embodied.
All-pervading—
defying spiritual powers with boldness,
cooled by the pure breeze’s fan.

**Orioles Through Willows**

Gazing at heaven’s expanse,
toward the three mountains and four seas,
mists and winds converge.
Metal, wood, and profound darkness,
clouds gather in an instant,
the six trigrams’ fire records advance in secret.

The seven returns’ work must be urgently refined,
the elixir’s essence fragrant as orchids.
At this stage, ghosts and spirits revere,
the three corpses are not permitted near.

Worldly passions shatter into dust.
The flames of ignorance and wrath are dashed,
turned to cold embers.
Wisdom’s treasury opens, the spirit shines,
claiming the Upper Clarity’s selected halls,
a name among the pure and outstanding.

The true form towers,
striding the void’s borders,
radiant with rosy clouds.
The body manifests nine suns,
transcending the dust—trust in this.

**Hundred Treasures Adorned**

Clouds and water—leisurely sentiments,
pine and bamboo—elegant conduct,
delving into the Dao’s true secrets.
Sweeping away mist and smoke,
forging the will like iron.

Unmoved by the joy of bamboo basket and gourd,
expanding the foolish valley,
cultivating brightness through plain simplicity.
Opening the heart’s breadth,
seizing inspiration in wild song,
brandishing the brush across the paper’s expanse.

Tiger and dragon roar in fury,
coiling ten thousand fathoms,
spraying resplendent words,
unfolding brocade’s pristine beauty.

In stillness, the work deepens,
the spirit’s use reveals utmost subtlety.
The nature-moon, thus thus—
its light fully revealed,
illuminating ancient and modern, round yet unbroken.

Merging with the formless qi,
spanning the eight directions,
the true body knows no distinction.

**Calming the Storm**

The work refines, the heart opens, wisdom’s treasury rounds.
A single point of numinous brightness surpasses the moon’s grace.
Beyond things, towering—alone in mystery,
neither empty nor existent, its form defies description.

Everywhere, it fully extends the unimpeded form,
shattering the void, boundless.
Joyous—liberated from the wheel of rebirth this very moment,
the achievement ascends.
Nine mysteries transcend the Supreme Tenuity’s heavens.

*Second Stanza*

Awakening binds the kalpa’s cool, vast cause.
A life of simplicity rises above the clamorous dust.
Every thing, every phenomenon—detached from the heart,
thoughts purified.
Diligently nurturing the primal spirit in the empty valley.

Meeting things with harmonious light, following virtue’s handle,
responding without fixed form, embracing heaven’s truth.
Vast and unobstructed, mastering the three mysteries’ essence,
treasuring the heart.
The Daoist’s talent and temperament—exceptionally pure and fresh.

*Third Stanza*

An inch of cinnabar heart, crushed and refined.
Wielding the wisdom-sea, stilling the winds and waves.
In the forest’s joy, content with plain sustenance,
harmonious.
Opening the heart-moon to illuminate the sahā world.

Within, the three accumulations of precepts are complete,
the body at ease, rich in the six pāramitās.
Hidden or manifest, the spirit roams, utterly free,
nowhere and everywhere.

chunks.translated_text:
Beyond the azure heavens, carefree and wandering.
*Mo Yu Er*
Nurturing detachment, dreams of indolence startle worldly airs;
floating clouds of wealth and honor—empty posturing.
Raising high the jeweled sword, its frosty mien cold,
the strife of petty minds all swept away.
Tamed are the ape and horse.
Yet when worldly affairs arise, the heart’s snares tangle and disturb.
A breast of ice, the mind’s cave luminous.
Delighting in pure realms, in action or retreat,
nurturing the sprouts of goodness,
knowing how much to drink from the water’s flow.

True qi swirls and billows,
the heart-pearl of the steadfast sea gleams bright.
Solemn and still beyond the clouds,
leaving the dust, auspicious signs conceive the cinnabar foundation.
Radiant as the rainbow’s arc, the spirit’s light,
crystalline and clear.
Shattering the ancient gloom of the crossroads,
illuminating the zenith of the dhyāna heavens.
The soul soars into boundless distance.
Freely treading the pure and subtle,
roaming the Dharma realms,
manifesting in flawless demeanor.

*Tune: Mu Lan Hua*
Qi harmonizes and blends, the wind’s charm keen.
Dragon coiled, tiger encircling,
the wu courtyard’s interlacing.
Gentle warmth lingers, the body entwined with spring snow.
The spirit’s light moonlike,
shining through the nine heavens.
Piercing the delusive clouds, the demonic ranks dissolve.
The three terraces and six viscera,
the eight passes—pure as ice.
The pure yang body attains the secret of non-doing.
Roaming the Dharma realms,
the Daoist’s sentiment—exquisitely pure.

*Liu Yao Ling*
Beholding heaven’s creation,
advancing to emulate the reclusive and serene.
Upholding the mean of firmness and yielding,
the five aggregates delight in non-doing.
Nurturing the nine suns’ auspicious signs,
the Kun palace’s Kan and Li conjoined.
At midday, the resplendent phoenix
soars above the river’s bend,
seeking the black turtle in the depths of ten thousand waves.
Purple mists shroud the mountain’s peak,
messages congeal in icy flesh.
Majestic and cool, the body’s bearing,
the six spirits at ease.
The three luminaries’ radiance unobstructed,
the sea’s edge a haven for carefree dwelling.
Amid the clouds, reclining at ease,
joyous and unbound,
the old visage—bright and expansive.

*Love for Reed Flowers*
The heart opens, five pairs forgotten,
the nature freed, six passions severed.
Qi, spirit, form—transforming,
the head’s crown empty, blood takes flight.
The banner of merit gleams with cinnabar’s luster,
the yang soul roused, its might fierce.
Unchanging from beginning to end, the true form revealed,
pervading without inside or out,
its appearance beyond distinction.
Born from arising and ceasing,
the body of purity—unbounded,
image-free, heaven’s midst pierced through.
The eye of true Dharma ultimately,
plucking the finest dust from the brows.
Radiance unfurls, ten thousand ages’ purity immaculate.
Round and bright, all things manifest,
lucid as the moon’s flaw.
